loans.name: Art

texts.en:
Art Hak Seng, a 35-year-old, is a Tuk Tuk driver in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. A Tuk Tuk is a cart pulled by a motor bike. People, especially foreigners, really like this kind of transportation because it is safer that a normal motor bike. Siem Reap is one of the beautiful provinces in Cambodia, and there are many famous temple that survived attacks by the foreigners.

On average, he makes $9 per day. His wife is a housewife and stays at home looking after their two children and cooking food for the whole family. (Pictured: husband, wife, and their son)

This couple are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase construction materials to build a stable house. Right now they have a thatch-wall house and this will not be safe if there is a big storm. The new house will provide better accommodations for the family. In the future, this couple plans to raise pigs to earn extra income.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a sturdier house

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi H., 38 years old, although still relatively young, is an industrious and quick-minded woman. She is always looking for ways to improve her family’s finances. In 2001 she joined the Fund for the first time. With a small loan, she invested in raising livestock; in subsequent rounds she always successfully put the loan to good use and brought in a high income. From then, her family was able to save up an amount of money. Even though the money saved up was not very much, it was enough for the family to invest in opening a store specializing in selling rice. This item is one item that people truly cannot live without. Starting with the small store, the family has been able to expand the business to a larger operation. Since shifting focus to this venture, she has seen the family’s finances improve faster; both her children are able to go to school. In this round of funding the family is requesting 15,000,000 VND. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Hậu 38 tuổi mặc dù tuổi đời còn trẻ nhưng là người phụ nữ năng động, nhanh nhẹn nên chị luôn tìm mọi cách làm ăn để nâng cao kinh tế gia đình. Năm 2001 chị tham gia vào Quỹ năm đầu với mức vốn còn nhỏ chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, qua các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều sử dụng hiệu quả và cho thu nhập cao, từ đó chị và gia đình đã tích lũy được một lượng vốn tuy không nhiều những cũng đủ để gia đình chị đầu tư mở một cửa hàng chuyên mua bán thóc gạo, đây chính là lương thực không thể thiếu của con người, từ một cửa hàng nho nhỏ đến nay cửa hàng của gia đình chị đã có quy mô lớn hơn, từ khi chuyển hướng kinh doanh chị thấy kinh tế gia đình phát triển nhanh hơn, 2 con chị đều được đầu tư ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in rice store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa is a member of Banco Comunal Compartir.

Luisa lives with her partner. She’s 28 years old and has 2 children. Luisa is from the San Martin de Paraiso community, Pacaycasa district, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Luisa has a store in her home, where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, and she also buys tara pods and cochineal insects and after gathering them sells them to customers in the city of Ayacucho.

Luisa and her husband also grow many types of vegetables depending on demand, and sell them at a market in the city of Ayacucho.

Luisa needs a 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soft drinks and fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Compartir. Luisa es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Luisa es de la c comunidad de San Martín de Paraíso, distrito de Pacaycasa, que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Luisa tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, también Luisa compra tara y cochinilla que luego de acopiar lo vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho a intermediarios.

Además Luisa junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras variadas dependiendo de la demanda, sus productos los vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Luisa necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas y frutas variadas.

loans.use: Luisa needs a loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, soft drinks, and fruit.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La Señora Anita, es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales, desde hace 10 años se dedica  al Diseño de Modas y costura, el taller está ubicado en la casa de sus  padres, en Jr. Francisco Pizarro Nº 165. Anita trabaja en base a pedidos y contratos de diferentes instituciones y personas particulares.

Las ventas han aumentado gracias a su responsabilidad, puntualidad y buen acabado de los productos, con ello espera mejorar su condición económica y disponibilidad de capital. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, y una maquina de coser, para contar con lo necesario cuando tiene que realizar sus trabajos que es la confección de uniformes de las entidades de la ciudad, y todo tipo de prendas de vestir que le solicitan sus clientes, las cuales muchas veces solo le piden el modelo para que ella los confeccione y los venda.

Ana es soltera, tiene 31 años,  es una mujer positiva y emprendedora, su meta  es tener una boutique y vender ropa para novias.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of "Las Moralinas" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin region and province, in the Morales district. For 10 years she has been a fashion designer and seamstress and has a workshop in her parents' house at 165 Jr. Francisco Pizarro. Anita takes custom orders and has contracts with various private groups and individuals. Anita's sales have increased because she is accountable and on time, and because she provides a fine finish to her products. She hopes this will help her improve her quality of life and availability of capital. She plans to use the loan of 1,200 soles (about $425) -- which will be paid back in 6 months -- to purchase thread in various colors; fabrics of various types, colors and finishes; and a sewing machine. Having these materials on hand will allow her to finish her work making uniforms for city offices, as well as all sorts of garments requested by her female clients (who often order only the model so she can make and sell them). Anita is single and 31 years old. She is a positive and enterprising woman whose goal in life is to own a boutique and sell bridal wear.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread, fabric and sewing machine

loans.name: Adela Albina

texts.es:
La señora Adela R. es cliente antigua, comenzó a trabajar con nosotros casi desde la fundación de Emprender primero en grupo solidario y posteriemente desde el año 2003 se individualizo como cliente empezando con un crédito de 500 dólares, a la fecha solicita un préstamo de 7000 Bs. Para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar los productos e insumos para repostería, la señora es una cliente muy dinámica, hasta hace poco tenía un contrato con el Colegio	
Loretto de la ciudad de La Paz para la producción y venta de desayunos en mencionado centro educativo, a su vez reparte sus productos en distintos establecimientos y oficinas de la zona sur de la ciudad, tiene dos hijos que le colaboran y que ya salieron profesionales, su	esposo trabaja en una compañía de electricidad, viajando constantemente. Actualmente presenta un historial de puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adela R. is a long-time member who started working with us almost since the founding of Emprender, first in a solidarity group, then in 2003 as an individual client. She stared with a loan of $500.00 USD, but she is currently requesting a 7,000.00 BOB loan in order to increase her work capital and purchase the products and supplies she needs for her bakery. She is a very dynamic customer who, until recently, had a contract with Colegio Loretto school in the city of La Paz to make and sell breakfast in this educational center. She concurrently delivers her baked goods throughout different institutions and offices in the southern area of the city. She has two children who collaborate with her and who are now professionals. Her husband works for an electric company, so he is constantly traveling. Up to now, she has had a history of payment punctuality and responsibility with our institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said has been in agrobusiness for 6 years. He has 1 hectare of land where he grows potatoes. He has two children growing up. He hopes to get a good harvest this season and pay for his children’s education. Although it is a hard job working at the field he works there every day hoping to get a rich harvest and earn a good profit. He wants to borrow money to purchase bags for potatoes.

loans.use: Said would like to purchase bags for potatoes at his potato farm.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el Jr. Sucre Nº 980, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años D. edad y es madre soltera con 5 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. gaseosas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes. Trabaja todas las mañanas atendiendo su negocio y brindando buena atención a sus clientes. 
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco D. arroz, 2 paquetes D. aceites, 2 cajas D. leche, 2 cajas D. vinagre, sillao, etc.

Tomasa es una mujer trabajadora. Se siente feliz por todo lo bueno que le ha pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Tomasa belongs to the Banco Comunal “Bellavista,” located in Jr. Sucre Nº 980 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in Ucayali. She is 60 years old and is a single mother with 5 adult children. With the first loan of S/. 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business selling carbonated beverages. She has been working with the bank for 5 years.

Currently, she owns and operates a grocery store. She works in the store every morning, bringing quality service to her clients.

With this loan of S/. 1,300, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a sack of rice, 2 packs of oils, 2 crates of milk, 2 crates of vinegar, soy sauce, etc.

Tomasa is a hard working woman. She feels happy for all the good things that have happened in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sack of rice, two packs of oils, two crates of milk, two crates of vinegar, soy sauce, etc.

loans.name: Saidnisso

texts.en:
Saidnisso M. is 38 years old. She lives in Khujand. She is married with 3 children. Mrs. M. is engaged selling hardware and she has a second business outlet selling men's wear.

Now Mrs. M. is applying for a KIVA loan in the amount of 4000 TJS with a term of 2 months to expand her existing business and for hardware (wood, tacks, metalwork units) that she wants to import from China. She thanks KIVA for support and wishes Kiva lenders all the very best for the coming year.

loans.use: to expand her existing businesses

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 18 años, vive en casa de su tía María de 42 años, donde alquiló un cuarto, y con quien vive desde hace 6 meses. Ella es una alegra y entusiasta joven que se dedica a la venta de mermeladas desde hace 2 años de forma ambulatoria, a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y el comercio es una buena alternativa, ya que es un negocio tranquilo y donde tiene más libertad, aunque para Claudia la responsabilidad es lo primero, trabaja durante casi todo el día ofreciendo su producto. Lo bueno es que su esfuerzo está dando frutos, ya que las ganancias van en aumento y ya puede pensar en agrandarlo. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tener que caminar tanto de casa, de lugar en lugar para obtener mejores ventas, pero con paciencia, Claudia espera incrementar sus ingresos y tener un mejor porvenir. En la búsqueda de querer expandir su negocio, conoció de los créditos de Microfinanzas Prisma, y ahora ya tiene su primer préstamo. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar más cantidad de mermelada para vender en mayor cantidad y por ende aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Claudia is 18 years old and lives with her Aunt Maria who is 42 and from whom she has rented a room for the past 6 months. She is a happy and enthusiastic youth who has been traveling selling jam for the past 2 years. She has always liked to work and sales is a good alternative as it is a peaceful business where she has a lot of freedom. For Claudia it is her first responsibility and she works during the day offering her products. The good news is that her efforts are bearing fruit and since profits are on the rise she is thinking of expanding her business. The most difficult part of her job is that she has to walk to each house, from place to place in order to obtain better sales, but with patience Claudia hopes to increase her income and to have a better future. In her search to expand her business, she came to know about Microfinanzas Prisma and this is her first loan. With the money she wants to buy more jam to sell in larger quantities and thus increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Boeng's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Kok Chork Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. S., is 48 years old and has been running her business as a fruit seller at the market for five years. From the business, she can earn an income of approximately US$ 3 per day. She is married and the good mother of six children; four of them are married and live away from home and the other two are students, while her husband is a local rice farmer. S.'s business is going well, because she is skilled at attracting customers to buy her fruit. In order to make her business more successful, S. is asking for a loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

The other two borrowers are:

S., aged 36, makes income by selling porridge from home. She applied for the loan as capital to buy chickens to raise and later on re-sell for a profit.

N., 24, sells groceries and she is requesting a loan to buy grocery inventory for re-sale. (N.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Salvador Mauricio

texts.es: Salvador Mauricio D. vive en Zaragoza departamento La Libertad , Mauricio tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa, su hijo y mamá. La Familia D. se dedica a la producción de pan, La panadería “La Fuente” como la ha llamado Mauricio tienen 7 años de experiencia. Es la favorita de muchos en la zona, La panadería la fuente le vende a muchas tiendas de colonias aledañas al por mayor, es por ello que Mauricio se decidió a solicitar a un crédito ya que necesitan abastecerse de materia prima para poder sacar más producción, ya que no alcanza sus producciones diarias, para satisfacer las necesidades de muchos clientes que buscan de su pan. Mauricio solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Salvador Mauricio D. lives in the Zaragoza department of La Libertad. Mauricio is 31 years old, lives with his wife, his son and his mother. The D. family is dedicated to the production of bread, the bakery "La Fuente," which is what Mauricio calls it, has 7 years of experience. It is the favorite of many people in the area, the La Fuente Bakery sells to a lot of stores in the neighboring areas, which is why Mauricio decided to ask for a loan since they ned to stock up on materials to be able to get more production, since they cannot reach their daily productions to satisfy the needs of many clients who look for their bread. Mauricio is asking for a loan for materials for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials for his bakery

loans.name: Bakhtawar

texts.en:
Bakhawar, son of Hjigullbar, lives in Jalalabad Nangrahar province. He has a mechanic shop and good experience in his business. Bakhawar has already successfully completed his first cycle loan and expanded his stock.

Still, he wants to expand his business with full success, so now he requests his second cycle loan to enlarge his shop to attract more customers and make good income to help his family.

Bakhawar is happy with this process of small loans and would like to thank all his lenders, Kiva and AFSG in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: Enlarge his mechanics shop.

loans.name: Kokoé Martine

texts.fr: Madame L. habite à Adidogomé, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle a commencé depuis 1999 le commerce de maïs et de charbons de bois.  Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter plus de maïs et bois.  Madame L. est mariée, et elle a trois enfants.
texts.en:
Ms L. lives in Adidogomé, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo. In 1999, she started doing commerce in corn and in charcoal. Wanting to expand her inventory to do better in her sales and in satisfying her customer, she's requesting her first loan to buy more corn and wood. Ms. L. is married, and she has three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and charcoal

loans.name: Truly

texts.en:
Truly M. is a good father to his children and a good husband to his wife, Mirasol. They have four children: Sherwel - 25 years old, a graduating college student; Truly Jr. - 23 years old; Jancel - 21 years old, a third year college student and Manilyn - 18 years old, a high school graduate.

Truly is a food vendor. He has sold ready-to-eat snacks in their village for two years. He now wants to borrow PHP 5,000 for the improvement of his vending business. He hopes that lenders will assist him financially for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: The improvement of his food-vending business

loans.name: Abdunosir

texts.en: K. Abdunosir is a farmer dedicated, for more than 17 years, to the production of potatoes and raising cattle. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper and the business of Abdunosir is the sole source of income for his family. His potato harvest is about to come and that is why he is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to acquire agricultural products and apply them to his harvest. With part of the loan he will also buy young cattle for raising and selling. Abdunosir wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his business will bring. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 42 years old and married with a child. She has a shop where she sells medicines to make a living. She is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Yaotcha

texts.fr:
H. Yaotcha est agée de 35 ans et née à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Yaotcha est mariée à KPEYITO Assogba, un maçon de profession. Yaotcha est mère de cinq (5) enfants : deux de ces enfants vont à l’école et les trois autres aident leur mère dans ses activités. Yaotcha réside avec sa famille à Hlacomè, un quartier très peuplé de la ville de Cotonou. 

C’est depuis 5 ans que Yaotcha est la restauration. Yaotcha vend aussi des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Pour ses achats, s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. 

Yaotcha a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener ses activités à un stade supérieur. Yaotcha veut  mieux développer les activités de son restaurant  en vue d’une meilleure prestation envers sa clientèle dont le nombre ne cesse de croitre. C’est pourquoi Yaotcha sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Yaotcha is 35 years old and was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to KPEYITO Assogba, a mason by profession, and is the mother of five children: two of them go to school, and the other three help their mother with her work. Yaotcha resides with her family in Hlacomè, a highly-populated district of the city of Cotonou. For five years, Yaotcha has been in the restaurant business. She also sells various goods: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardine, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, charcoal, phone recharge cards, etc. As for her purchases, she stocks up at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Yaotcha has already benefited from four loans with Alidé, and she has repaid them. She was able to use them to raise her business to a higher level. She wants to improve her restaurant business with the aim of providing a better offering to her customers, who are ever-growing in number. This is why she is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 50-kg sacks of rice, a 500-mg box of macaroni, 25 kilos of beans, a 100-kg sack of corn, and a 25-L drum of oil

loans.name: Juanito Genaro

texts.es:
"Don Juanito tiene 27 años de edad, es chofer propietario de un radio taxi, el señor está casado con doña Marcela Añamuri, la misma que trabaja como contratista en la construccion en los puentes trillisos, tienen un hijo.
Don Juanito está solicitando el crédito para realizar un mantenimiento preventivo de su vehículo, pues tiene mucho cuidado con el mismo, ya que se constituye en su fuente principal de trabajo."
texts.en:
Juanito is 27 years old and makes a living driving a radio taxi he owns. He is married to Marcela Añamuri, who works as a construction contractor in Puentes Trillizos, and together they have a son. Juanito is requesting the loan so he can perform preventative maintenance on his vehicle; he is very careful with it because it represents his main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform preventative maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta B. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Loreta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta plants and harvests rice to sell in the local community. Loreta has been in the business for five years.

In 2009, Loreta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Loreta is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Loreta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for rice crops.

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math S., 39, and her husband, 36, support their family by fishing with nets along the Mekong river. They always wake up at dawn every day to gather the fish from their nets which they put in the water the night before. After that they re-set the nets in the water to harvest fish again in the late afternoon.

After gathering the fishes from the river, S. hurries to the market so that she can sell at a suitable price. Recently, S. and Soe decided to take out a loan of $400 to buy an engine for their fishing boat.

They have four children all of whom are still young and attend school.

loans.use: To buy a motor for their boat

loans.name: Stany

texts.en: Stany J. currently lives in Hai Jebel, south of the town of Gudele, Juba City. She is a married woman with three children and is 25 years old. Stany’s business is selling tomatoes, cooking oil and onions and she is requesting a loan to improve on her stock. She will purchase and stock more foodstuffs to sell at the market. With the extra profits from her loan, Stany hopes to pay school fees for her children and to provide them with scholastic materials. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more foodstuffs to sell at the market

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 36 years old, married and has three children. They are living in Barangay General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. Marlon is glad for having a simple but happy family.

Marlon is a farmer and he manages a 1.5 hectare farm lot that supports most of their important needs in the family. He is also maintaining a tricycle transport business for additional income. He wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 that he can use for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle for the safety of his passengers.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of motorcycle

loans.name: Muhlali Hamad Group

texts.en: Muhlali Hamad is the group leader of Muhlali Hamad group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for progress her/his business. Muhlali wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. Hamad wants to take a loan for the business of vegetables selling shop. And they are requested a group of loan 28000 Afghani. And they thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For progress business

loans.name: Hellen Abalem

texts.en: Hellen Abalem L. sells clothes in a stall in a retail market in downtown Thika.  Her offerings focus on bed linens and baby clothes; she has done this for 10 years and has one employee.  She is using her KES 50,000 loan proceeds to increase her inventory. One challenge her business faced is that her kiosk had to be taken down due to a city counsel ruling and she has had to relocate. Hellen is married to a mechanic who has his own shop and they have two children ages 6 and 11. Hellen describes herself as a hardworking, honest businesswoman, and her goal is to have branches of her clothes stall in three nearby villages.

loans.use: To increase stock of sheets, bed covers and baby clothes

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has been selling secondhand children’s clothes for the last two years and previously sold vegetables in a kiosk. She is 33 years old and married with a young son named William. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add an assortment of new inventory.

For the future, Catherine hopes to have a stable business so that she is able to provide for her family’s needs along with her husband. She would like to own permanent business premises and become a wholesale supplier. She describes herself as determined, committed, and persistent in her business.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking micro-finance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive solo en su casa propia. 
Su negocio es un taller de reparación de motos y motocarros, pare ello alquiló un inmueble en una zona muy concurrida, allí trabaja en sociedad con su hermano, quien también es mecánico. 
Pero la actividad que desempeña a Francisco es el torno (se encarga de los embocinados, arreglos de bielas y otros referentes a las partes internas de un motor) y la soldadura.
Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 4 años atrás y trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
Francisco se preocupa en demostrar a sus clientes que el trabajo que realiza es bueno, además es un negocio muy rentable porque no hay moto o motocarro en su localidad que deje de acudir a su taller. 
Posteriormente, le gustaría tener su propio taller de torno.

Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque cuando tienen problemas saben solucionarlos pronto y son muy organizados y responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más herramientas para incrementar su taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
Francisco, 28, is single and lives in his own house. He has a motorcycle and motor vehicle repair shop in a rented space located in a very busy area. He is partnered with his brother, who is also a mechanic. Francisco's specific task, however, is running the lathe (he is in charge of boring, connecting rods, and everything else that has to do with the interior parts of the engine), and welding. He has been doing this for the past 4 years and his work day goes from 6am until 6pm. Francisco makes an effort to show his customers that he does high quality work and his profits are good because there isn't a motorcycle or a motor vehicle in his area that fails to come to his shop. In the future, he would like to own his own lathe workshop. This is his second credit with MFP. He likes working with his communal bank because they know how to solve problems quickly and they are very well organized and responsible. With the funds requested he will buy more tools to add to his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for his workshop.

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en:
Yinka is 34 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Yinka sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendliness skills to attract more customers to her stall.

This is the high season for her business and Yinka hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Aurelia D.

texts.en:
Aurelia D. P. is from the village of Silongon in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Aurelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,600 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aurelia D joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia D has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 14500 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Aurelia's 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Apolline

texts.fr: Madame A. Apolline est une femme âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle habite avec sa famille à Kpélé-Atimé. Elle tient une baraque dans laquelle elle vend les produits de l’alimentation générale. Avec ce crédit, elle se déplacera sur Kpalimé, une ville plus grande que son village de Kpélé-Atimé, où elle s’approvisionne en produits d’alimentations générales qu’elle revend à un bon prix dans sa localité et de ses environ. Les bénéfices qu’elle dégagera lui permettront d’améliorer le quotidien de sa famille et de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Apolline A. is a 36-year old woman who is married with four children. She lives with her family in Kpélé-Atimé. She has a hut in which she sells general grocery products. With this loan, she will go to Kpalimé, a larger town than the village of Kpélé-Atimé, where she will stock up with general grocery products that she will sell on at a good price in her village and the surrounding area. The profits that she makes will allow her to improve the daily living conditions of her family and to pay for her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of general grocery products

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia LUISA, pertenece al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, Nuestra socia vende emolientes (son bebidas calientes a base de linaza, airampo, cebada, limón, mates frescos y  naturales de plantas o hierbas medicinales) y desayunos de quinua (otra bebida caliente con leche y quinua hervidas), estás bebidas calientes se venden en carritos y son fuente energética para el cuerpo y si se adoleciera de cualquier enfermedad, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para seguir preparando sus deliciosas y energeticas bebidas.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Pro Desarrollo” (Pro Development). She lives in Pisac, which lies in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. Pisac is located 40 minutes away from the city. It is small town that inherited beautiful Incan structures, which is required sightseeing by all tourists who visit the city of Cusco. Luisa is 35 years old, married, and has two children (ages 13 and 11). She divides her time between her household activities and running her business. Luisa sells natural remedies that consist of hot beverages containing linseed, cactus juice, barley, lemon, teas, and other plants and herbs. She also prepares a breakfast porridge made of quinoa and boiled milk. Luisa sells these warm beverages from her cart. They are a source of energy for the body and are helpful when recovering from any type of disease. Luisa is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her business. She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing natural remedies

loans.name: Elsia

texts.es:
Elsia tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos esta 
en edad escolar. Ella inicio el negocio de venta de verduras y legumbres con un
capital obtenido por ahorros de sus trabajos anteriores, adquirio el puesto por 
medio de créditos, ya que incremento su negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Ella atiende 
el negocio de manera muy calida y amable, además le ofrece a sus cliente precios bajos, el sueño de Elsia es poder brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación,  ya que su hija mayor acaba de ingresar a ala universidad,Elsia desea brindarles a sus hijos lo mejor, por ello trabaja a diario para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elsia is 42 years old. She lives in her own house with her two children, of whom one is school-age. She began her business selling fruits and vegetables with capital obtained from savings from her previous jobs. She acquired the produce stand using loans and is already growing her business with a lot of work. She attends to the business in a way that is very warm and nice. Furthermore, she offers her customers low prices. Elsia's dream is to be able to give her children a good education, not that her oldest daughter has just entered college. Elsia wants to give her children the very best, which is why she works daily to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
En el municipio del Sauce en Achuapa, La señora Imelda M. M. se dedica a atender su pulpería que posee desde hace 7 años.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos tales como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, etc. Con el crédito obtiene más ingreso para el desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Sauce in Achuapa, Señora Imelda M. M. tends to her general store, which she has had for 7 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase products such as sugar, rice, beans, etc. With the loan, she will obtain greater income for the advancement of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Esther Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther  tiene como actividad la atencion de un salon de fiestas infantiles a demas de la elaboracion de cotillones, canastitas y adornos para fiestas infantiles, cumpleaños y otros.
Esta atividad que realiza es un apoyo al ingreso de su familia, la misma  que esta compuesta por su esposo  Don Fernando y sus tres hijos, de esta manera ayuda al sustento de su familia, el destino del credito es para compra de sillas plasticas para el salon que ella atiende a demas de un equipo de sonido para el mismo ya que esta alquilando un local para fiestas infantiles, Uno de sus deseos es el de ser muy conocida por tener uno de los mejores salones de fiestas infantiles y asi poder tener muchos clientes, es una persona responsable y dinamica, Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Esther manages an activity hall for children’s parties. She also makes party favors, baskets, and decorations for children’s parties, birthdays, and other events.

Esther operates her business in order to help with the income to support her family, which consists of her husband Don Fernando and their three children. This loan will be used to buy plastic chairs for her activity hall. She also wants to acquire sound equipment that can be rented out for children’s parties.

One of her wishes is to become known for having one of the best locations for hosting children’s parties so that she can attract more customers. Esther is a responsible and dynamic person. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs & sound (music) equipment

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 43 años, es divorciado y vive solo en casa alquilada. Desde hace 15 años que trabaja de manera independiente, tiene su propia banda musical, en donde tiene presentaciones en eventos sociales como: fiestas de graduación, matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños y todo tipo de eventos. Por lo que lleva mucha experiencia en este trabajo de producción  musical. Él es el representante de su banda, además toca la batería electrónica, por lo que disfruta mucho de este trabajo, en compañía de sus demás compañeros. Este negocio de presentaciones musicales, le es rentable para  Saúl, porque hay gran demanda de su trabajo y frecuentemente siempre hay eventos que se realiza en su ciudad. Su deseo es  mejorar su banda con instrumentos nuevos, además de extender la fama de su banda por toda la región. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por  lo que ha demostrado en este tiempo, ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Además considera que éste crédito es importante para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en los gastos de las presentaciones que tiene, como: transporte y el alquiler de equipos de sonido.
texts.en:
Saul is 43 years old and divorced, and lives alone in a house that he rents. For 15 years he has worked independently, and he has his own music band, where he has performed in social gatherings such as graduation parties, weddings, baptisms, birthdays, and all types of events. He has a lot of experience in the music business. He is the representative member of his band, and he also plays the electric drums. This is why he enjoys his work, in the company of the other members of the band. This business of music performances is profitable to Saul since there is great demand for his work and frequently there are events that are done in his city. His wish is to improve his band with new instruments, and to extend the fame of his band throughout the region. This is his ninth loan with MFP, and he has been very responsible in his payments throughout this time. Furthermore, he considers that this credit is important for the progress of his work. The proceeds of this loan will be invested in expenses related to his performances such as transportation and the rental of sound equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expenses related to his performances such as transportation and the rental of sound equipment

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Mrs. Saing N. was born in 1981. She is married and has two young children who are enrolled in school. To seek a daily income Saing N. is a garden keeper who works for a private company located in Phnom Pen. Her husband works with her in the same field and company.

Although they try to work hard, their income is frequently not adequate to support their family. Saing N. wants to invest in a new trade because she hopes she will get extra income.

Because Saing N. has no money yet, she is applying for a loan to buy a trailer that she will connect with an existing motorcycle that belongs to her husband, who operates a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a trailer.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Víctor P. M., tiene la edad de 55 años, está casado, y vive con lsu esposa y su hija de 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos que ofrece en su pulpería. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Víctor P. M., 55, is married and lives with his wife and 12-year-old daughter. He wants funds to increase his stock inventory in order to have a more varied and assorted stock in his grocery store. He started out in this line of work several years ago and has many good customers. This is why he’d like to offer a larger variety of products in the store besides, it would generate higher income for his family’s economy. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful for the terms offered. He hopes to provide his family with better quality of life and improved economic stability in the future in order to continue developing as a person and as a merchant. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children.

To make a living Haydee raises crops. She and her husband also opened a metal shop that her husband mainly operates. Haydee has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.

In 2008, Haydee joined CEVI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haydee has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI.

Haydee is requesting her 6th loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Apasara

texts.en:
Apasara T. has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 12 and her daughter is in grade 8. Both Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Sailendra T. are engaged in a cow-raising business.They already own one cow and they have been selling milk in their area. In Nepal pure and fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition. They live in Sainbu-Bhaishapati and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.

They carry their milk containers and sell door-to-door daily in the morning and in the evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, they want to buy another cow to increase their production.  So  Mrs. Apasara plans to use her loan to purchase a jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a dedicated farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. She is 49 years old and married with 9 children ages 7 to 31. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Betty has been practising mixed farming for 10 years and has employed one person from the community. Her main products are milk, maize, beans and poultry, which she sells to the local market. Her major challenge has been diseases which attack her dairy cows, therefore affecting her milk production.

Betty has successfully completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 40,000 and has requested this loan for KES 40,000 to expand her poultry project. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of chickens and build a poultry house. The extra income from this loan will assist her to provide for her family's basic needs.

Betty hopes to get more loans to expand her poultry project and be the main milk supplier to the local market. In five years' time, Betty would like acquire 2 dairy cows to help her be the main milk supplier to the local market.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Nenencia

texts.en:
Nenencia D. C. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Nenencia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenencia owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling ice cream products to local businesses and community members. Nenencia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenencia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nenencia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en: This group loan has five members who live in Voat Svay village in Takeo province. Mrs. Run K. is a group leader who was born in 1959, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Yan Srey, are farmers who own two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also a pig breeder. Her problem is that her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Run K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, and rest of the loan she rents plow machine plow her field. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lourdes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lourdes es mujer esforzada, madre de tres hijos, comerciante desde hace catorce años en donde ha venido aumentando el nivel de ventas.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con poca mercadería y gracias  a su tenacidad ha venido incrementando su pequeña pulpería, por años. 
A si mismo Hoy en día tiene poco inventario ya que ha estado un poco mal de salud, y gastado mucho en medicamento, con ayuda de su esposo ha salido a delante ya que también el trabaja como pequeño comerciante en la venta de carne de res.
También a través del apoyo con los financiamientos de Afodenic ha logrado incrementar y equilibrar sus ventas ya que es su cuarto crédito que ha venido pagando mensualmente. Lo que le permite poder cumplir con su pago y pagar también sus gastos básicos.
Con este préstamo comprara: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosa, productos enlatados y otros logrando poder aumentar el inventario y vender mas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a hard-working woman and the mother of three children. She has been a businesswoman for fourteen years, during which she has gradually increased her sales volume. When she began, she had only a little merchandise, but thanks to her tenacity, she has gradually expanded her little food store over the years. Currently, she is low on inventory, because she has suffered a few health problems and has spent a lot of money on medicines. With her husband's help, she has gotten through this situation, since he also works as a small businessman, selling beef. Also through the support of loans from Afodenic she has been able to increase and stabilize her sales. This is her fourth loan, and she has been making monthly payments. This permits her to make her payments while also covering her basic expenses. With this loan, she will buy basic grains, dairy products, snacks, soft drinks, canned goods and other items, so that she can increase her inventory and sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, dairy products and other items to increase her sales

loans.name: Carlos Alejandro

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil y vende mariscos como pescados, camarones y conchas tiene dos hijos y uno que falleció.  

Empezó a vender mariscos desde que se caso para tener mas ingresos para su familia, poco a poco compro pescados, camarones etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. Cada librar de pescado la vende a $ 2.00, la libra de camarones la vende a $ 2.50. 

Para incrementar los mariscos que tiene en su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo pescados, conchas y camarones. El nos comento que no quiere afanarse del por venir del mañana por lo que dice la Biblia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old. He lives in a suburb of Guayaquil and he sells seafood such as fish, shrimp, and oysters. He has two children and one who passed away. He started to sell seafood when he was married in order to have more income for his family. Little by little, he bought fish, shrimp, etc. He works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. He sells every pound of fish for $2.00, and a pound of shrimp costs $2.50. In order to increase the amount of seafood he has in his business he wants to buy fish, oysters and shrimp with the loan. He tells us he does not want to be anxious for what tomorrow will bring, as the Bible says.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish, oysters

loans.name: Cely

texts.en:
Cely R. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 33 years old. Cely is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cely owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Cely has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Cely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Cely is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., 23, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets, earning an income of USD 2.30 per day. Her husband is a teacher for a local school, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 250 to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: pay the children's school fees

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es casado, tiene 39 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Tumi de Oro del caserío Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Se dedica a labores relacionadas con la agricultura, el suele criar ganado vacuno y caprino para su posterior engorde y venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar sembrando algunos granos y cereales en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta. Con estas actividades el saca adelante a su familia.

Marcelino desea realizar algunos arreglos en su terreno para poder instalar el cultivo de arroz en los próximos meses, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Marcelino is married, 39 years old, and lives with his wife and four children in the Tumi de Oro section of the town of Yencala Boggiano.  This is a rural, primarily agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque district, which is more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to work related to agriculture, such as raising cattle and goats for later sale.  In addition, he works planting some grains and cereals on a small plot of land that he has.  With these activities, he helps his family get ahead.

Marcelino would like to make some improvements to his soil, in order to plant rice in the next few months.  For this reason, he has requested his first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a hard-working father, who is very devoted to his family.  He is well liked and trusted by the people who know him.

loans.use: To improve his soil in order to plant rice.

loans.name: Yara Lizeth

texts.es: La Sra.  Yara Lizeth G. P.  ella es Trabajadora activa del hotel Barceló Monte limar  desempeñándose como Asistente de recursos humanos  tiene  cuatro años de trabajar en esta empresa, es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación, estos créditos con Ceprodel le han brindado la oportunidad de  mejorar su nivel de vida teniendo un techo digno.
texts.en: Mrs. Yara Lizeth G. P. is an employee at the  Barceló Montelimar Hotel.  She works as the Human Resources Assistant and has been working for that company for four years.  She is married and has a school-aged son.  She has had four loans with CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy construction materials for home improvements.  These loans through CEPRODEL have provided her with the opportunity to improve her quality of life by getting an adequate roof.

loans.use: Construction materials (sand, cement, stone)

loans.name: Urunana Group

texts.en: Jeannette is 23 years old. She is married and has one child, who is nine months old. Her husband is a carpenter. Jeannette is the group leader of the borrowing group called Urunana Group. Urunana means "let us join hands." Jeannette sells a variety of items in her shop, such as salt, sugar, soap and rice. She has had this business for three years. With this loan she will increase her inventory. The profits will be reinvested back into the business. She says that her business is successful because of the quality service she extends to her customers. In the future she would like to import new products.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.name: Martha Janneth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Martha S. es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la comunidad de Guncay que  pertenece a la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica que encierra su centro histórico, su gente es muy calida,  amable y conservan su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia es una mujer muy joven, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su mamá se dedica a la venta de quesillo, su padre es chofer profesional y maneja un camión, sus padres tienen casa propia y es gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo.

La Señorita. Martha se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años, a sus pollos los compra muy pequeños pero en tres semanas ya están listos para la venta y los vende pelados a sus fieles clientes. También cuenta con un local en donde vende productos naturales hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito y fue invitada por una tía a formar parte del banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es superarse mas y su sueño es  tener una casa y un vehiculo propio.
texts.en:
Miss Martha S. is a member of the Mi Bankito communal bank.  She lives in Guncay which is part of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is knows for its architectural beauty surrounding its historic city center.  Its residents are warm and kind and keep their culture and traditions.

Martha, 21, is a very young woman.  She is single and lives with her parents.  Her mother sells quesillo (a popular local cheese) and her father is a professional truck driver.  Her parents own their home thanks to the effort they put into their work.

Martha has been raising chickens for the past 5 years.  She buys the chickens when still very small but in three weeks they are ready for sale; she sells them dressed to her regular customers.  She also has a locale where she has sold natural products for the last three years.  She works from Sunday through Sunday with not a single day off from 8am until 3pm.

She is in her 3rd loan.  She was invited by her aunt to join the communal bank.  She will use the new loan to buy chickens and feed for them.  Her goal is to improve still more and her dream is to have a house and a car of her own.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es:
Doña Sarbelia, administra un cafetín donD. venD. pupusas y bebidas, tiene 52 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo Aldo D. 21 años D. edad, residen e Yoloaiquin departamento D. Morazán,  el negocio tiene más D. 21 años D. existir y lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana D. 3:00pm hasta 9:00pm, por las mañanas prepara todo lo necesario para la preparación D. las pupusas, el gusto por la cocina lo desarrollo al lado D. su madre.
Ella tiene planes D. inversión en el negocio y solicita un préstamo para poder desarrollarlo, su compra seria D. bebidas como sodas, gatoraD., jugos, y para las pupusas chicharrón, quesillo, pollo, condimentos, este préstamo le ayuda a incrementar el negocio a disponer D. productos y atender a más clientes para garantizar los ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Ella quiere cancelar puntualmente este préstamo, el sueño es crece con el negocio y poder construir un nuevo local granD. donD. pueda atender muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Sarbelia runs a cafe where she sells 'pupusas' (thick corn tortillas with a savory filling) and soft drinks.  She is 52 years old and lives with her husband and her 21 year-old son Aldo.  They live in Yoloaiquin, in Morazán department.  She has had her business for more than 21 years and she serves in it every day of the week from 3.00pm to 9.00pm.  In the mornings she gets ready everything she needs to prepare her 'pupusas'.  She got her love of cooking from her mother.

Sarbelia has plans to invest in her business and she is requesting a loan so that she can do this.  She will buy drinks such as soda, gatoraD. and juices.  For the 'pupusas' she will buy 'chicharrón' (pork crackling), 'quesillo' (cheese), chicken and seasonings.  This loan will help her to increase her business, to have products available and to serve more customers so that she can guarantee her income and support her family.

Sarbelia would like to make her loan repayments punctually.  Her dream is to grow with her business and to be able to build new, bigger premises where she can serve a lot of customers.

loans.use: To buy drinks (soda and juice), pork crackling and cheese

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 26 years old and is single, but cares for two adopted orphans. Paul owns a small business where he sells different items in a shop, such as soap, beans, phone vouchers, salt and other kinds of domestic items. He employs three people in his business, which is well-known and organized, and this is his fifth year in operation. He works from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening every day.
 
Paul has requested a loan to purchase more products for his store. This purchasing of soap, cosmetics, sugar, etc will allow him to improve his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 43 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,shampus,colonias,pérfumes entre otros mas , a la vez la socia trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud como asistenta en enfermería ,la socia se dedica a estas dos actividades y de esta manera saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the "LOS HERALDOS" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Margarita is 43 years old, married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products such as creams, shampoo, cologne, perfumes, etc.  She also works for the Ministry of Health as a nursing assistant.  Through these two activities, she manages to get her family ahead in life.

Margarita is requesting this loan to buy more products for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business

loans.name: Maria Patrocinia

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Patrocinia García tiene 67 años de edad, esta casada y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, tiene mas de tres años de radicar en la colonia Buena Vista y se a dedicado desde hace 3 años a la venta de refrescos, pan, churros y abarroteria en general en su pequeño negocio ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar productos para su pulperia, desea surtirla para tener mas variedad de productos.
 
Maria es una mujer muy seria y de pocas palabras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Patrocinia García is 67, married and has no dependent children. She settled in the Buena Vista development over three years ago, and has sold drinks, bread, churros and groceries for three years in her small business, located in her home.

She will use this loan to purchase products for her general store. She would like to stock it with a greater variety of products.

Maria is a very serious woman of few words.

loans.use: the purchase of drinks, juice, toilet paper, batteries, candles, matches, butter, oil, rice, sugar, bread, beans, salt, condiments, eggs

loans.name: Santos Bentura

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos Bentura P. tiene 44 años de edad y trabaja en la Fabrica de Tabacos (RAICES CUBANAS S.DE R.L.) desempeñándose como Vigilante.
El Sr. Santos P. es una persona que goza de estabilidad laboral, tiene varios años de laborar para la empresa antes mencionada.
El Sr. Santos utilizara el credito para comprar materiales de construccion ya que desea hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación.
Don Santos es casado y su esposa a dado a luz a tres hijos los que en la actualidad están cursando sus estudios secundarios, nos comentaba don Santos que el hace todo lo posible por darles los estudios a sus hijos ya que es lo único que el les puede dejar de herencia.
dichas mejoras a su casa es para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Bentura P., age 44, works as a security guard in a tobacco factory (Raices Cubanas de R.L.).

Mr. Santos P. is a person who enjoys work stability.  He has worked for the above mentioned company for several years.

Mr. Santos will use the loan to buy construction materials.  He wishes to make improvements on his house.

Mr. Santos is married, and they have three children.  The children are currently in high school.  Mr. Santos tells us that he does everything possible to give his children an education.  It is the only thing that he can leave them as an inheritance.

The improvements to his house are to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, iron, flooring, sand, and paint

loans.name: Lavodi Plus Group

texts.en:
M. is the leader of the Community Bank named “Lavodi Plus”.  It is composed of 12 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

M. is 40 years old and the father of five children whose ages vary between 1 and 12 years old. Three of them go to school. He has been active in his business since 1999. He sells mattresses in the western area of Kinshasa. He has already taken out three loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. Thanks to Hope’s loans, his business has prospered and it generates a profit of $100 per week. 

M. intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of his business by buying some more mattresses to resell at a profit and increase his income. His ambition is to diversify his business and become a provider in his environment. He works hard in order to achieve his dream.

loans.use: increasing his stock by buying some fresh foods and reselling them at a profit

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma H.  agradece nuestra colaboración en el anterior crédito debido al cual pudo techara la parte trasera de su casa, así como también impermeabilizar algunas partes de la casa lo que genero una mayor comodidad  para su familia. Ella está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo esta vez para hacer una mejora interna a la casa ya que desea poder poner el vitropiso para que su casa sea más confortable, ya que el principal deseo de la señora Norma y su esposo es poder brindarle a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio. La Sra. Norma planea pagara dicho crédito  con la ayuda de su esposo ya que él se hará cargo de los gastos de la casa para que ella utilice a plenitud sus ingresos de secretaria para pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma H. is grateful for our previous loan that she used to install roofing on the rear part of her house as well as waterproof parts of the house; this produced greater comfort for her family.

She is once again asking for a loan this time to do some interior improvements in the house.  She wants to install ceramic tile flooring so that the house will be more comfortable because Norma’s and her husband’s main wish is to provide their children with a better inheritance.

Norma plans to repay the loan with help from her husband.  He will take over paying household expenses so that she can use her entire salary as a Secretary to repay the loan.
.

loans.use: To install ceramic tile flooring.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn Q. is from the village of Plaridel St, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Marlyn is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living Marlyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of the business's income comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, beverages and powder juices to the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009 Marlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages and canned goods. This loan will be the second taken out by Marlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan I., 57, is a married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 35 years old. 

Susan and her husband are both farmers. She helps in growing crops such as corn and rice. She also helps sell their harvest to the market.

Susan requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies. She hopes to have a sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 7 and 15, in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Zavhan province of Mongolia. His two children both attend local secondary school while his wife helps with the family shoe-making business. 

Batbaatar started his business in 2004 at his home. Batbaatar is responsible for making the traditional handicraft footwear items, including shoes, boots, sandals etc.. On the other hand his wife, Bayasgalan, is responsible for selling their shoes at a rented stall at a trading center. They have managed to build a strong customer base and their customers are satisfied with the quality and uniqueness. Batbaatar and his wife are planning to expand and continue their business in the future. 

He is a hardworking man who says, "I want to buy a sophisticated sewing machine in order to increase our product sales." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a sewing machine from China and some materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Barra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BARRA est composé de quatre femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, époux et enfants. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de BOUGOUNI, région de SIKASSO en république du Mali. Ces dames se sont connues par des relations de mariage et de commerce. Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur capacité  financière enfin de faire assez de stock, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce des céréales et de condiments. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et elles n’ont connues aucun problème de remboursement. 
Avec ce prêt Adiaratou D. la présidente du groupe compte acheter 200kg de beurre de karité et 500 kg de graines de néré.
