Les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs des  villages environnants de Bougouni pour ensuite être revendus en détail et en gros sur le marché de BOUGOUNI au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The BARRA group is made up of four married women whose average age is 30 with four children each, on average. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers and sisters, husbands and children. These women live in the Massablacoura district of the town of BOUGOUNI, SIKASSO region, in the Republic of Mali. They met because of being in-laws or business colleagues. With a view to growing their working capital so that they can purchase enough stock, they decided to join the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sell cereals and condiments. They are on their second group loan and they have had no problem with reimbursement.  

With this loan Adiaratou D. , the president of the group, intends to buy 200 kg of shea butter and 500 kg of  "néré" seeds. These products are bought from suppliers in the villages surrounding Bougouni to be sold wholesale or retail at the BOUGOUNI market, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed essentially of women. 
 
With this loan, the women hope to make a monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be used for their business needs.

loans.use: to purchase condiments for resale.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 36 años de edad vive junto a sus dos pequeños niños en el distrito artesano de Monsefú - Lambayeque.  El hogar de Cruz no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

La falta de una buena calidad de vida, motiva a Cruz  a dar su máximo esfuerzo en su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de Moshoqueque (a  30 minutos del distrito de Monsefú). Cruz cuenta con un puesto fijo en dicho mercado. El mercado Moshoqueque es el más  conocido  de Lambayeque, es el mercado con mayor comercialización de productos en toda la región. Cruz vende verduras en el mercado de Moshoqueque desde hace 10 años.

Cruz es una madre e hija amorosa, siempre dispuesta a ayudar a su familia. Ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1300 nuevos soles para habilitar los servicios higiénicos de la casa de sus padres. Es una prioridad para Cruz que sus padres vivan adecuadamente, es por eso que prefiere brindarles esa ayuda antes que beneficiarse ella con el crédito.

Cruz  tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales, estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el préstamo.
texts.en:
Cruz is 36 years old and lives with her two small children in the artisanal district of Monsefú, Lambayeque.  Cruz’s home does not have all basic utilities.

Cruz is motivated to work hard because she lacks a good quality of life.  She sells vegetables in the Moshoqueque market (30 minutes from Monsefú District).  Cruz has a fixed stand at the market.  The Moshoqueque market is the best known in Lambayeque.  It is the market with the most products available for sale in the entire region.  Cruz has sold vegetables there for the last 10 years.

Cruz is a loving mother and daughter always ready to help her family.  She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1300 new sol loan to install a toilet in her parents’ house.  It’s a priority for Cruz that her parents live adequately and this is why she’d rather provide them with this help before benefitting herself with this loan.

Cruz has good personal and work references; she is very grateful for having been granted the loan.

loans.use: to install a toilet in her parents' house.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.en:
Avilata, a single woman in her early 20's, has been running a beauty salon for one year now. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 8.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be Avilata's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to purchase more salon equipment, the same use to which she put her first loan.

Avilata will share this loan with her loan group "Ushindi" which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more salon equipment.

loans.name: Petrona Isabel

texts.es: Petrona Isabel de 36 aaños de edad es casada, tiene 2 niños: el mayor cursando la primaria y el menor en preescolar. Petrona es vendedora de productos cosmeticos Vogue desde hace varios años, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido quien asume los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando su 3er credito para continuar la construccion de su casa, poniendole el piso, pintarla y otros detalles que no logro hacer con el credito anterior. Petrona sueña con ver construida su casa,ya que es el patrimonio que sus padres le estan dando y en el futuro piensa mejorarla para que sus hijos tengan mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Petrona Isabel, 36, is married and has 2 children.  The oldest is in elementary school, and the younger one is in preschool.  Petrona has been selling Vogue cosmetic products for a number of years.  She relies on the support of her husband, who pays the household expenses.  She is requesting her third loan to continue with some work on her house: putting in a floor, painting, and other finishing work that she was not able to finance with her previous loan.  Petrona dreams of seeing all of the improvements to her house finished, since the house is an inheritance from her parents and she has plans to improve it so that her children will be able to live in greater comfort.

loans.use: to put in a new floor in her house

loans.name: V. Jonas

texts.fr: Né le 5 avril 1984 au Bénin, Jonas est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Le couple à trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Jonas vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Jonas assure avec sa femme les différentes charges de la maison. Jonas a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Jonas mène comme activité depuis neuf ans la décoration. Pour exercer convenablement ce métier, Jonas a besoin de fournitures de décoration (peinture, encre etc.). Jonas s’approvisionne alors au Nigéria et au Togo, tous États voisins du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Jonas sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born on April 5, 1984 in Bénin, Jonas is married to Béatrice, a merchant.  The couple has three children in their care; two are their own children.  Some of the children are in school.  Jonas lives with his wife and children.  With his wife, he provides for the household expenses.  Jonas attended school up to high school.  To provide for his needs and those of his children, Jonas has been running a decoration business for nine years.  To practice this profession properly, Jonas needs decoration supplies (paint, ink etc.).   He gets his supplies in Nigeria and Togo, neighboring states of Bénin.  This business generates income that helps him take care of the family’s various expenses.  Jonas is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to expand his business and increase his profit.

loans.use: To buy cans of paint and ink.

loans.name: Jacinta Nicolasa

texts.es:
Jacinta Nicolasa tiene 34 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Jacinta se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos. Enfrednta desafios como plagas en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar una finca para trabajar con toda la familia.

En los tiempos libre le gusta rhacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Jacinta Nicolasa is 34 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Jacinta is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Jacinta is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs. She faces challenges such as pests attacking her crops.  Her dream is to buy a farm that she can work on together with her family.

In her spare time, Jacinta enjoys practicing sports with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria Lilia

texts.es:
Gloria D. 57 años es madre D. familia, vive con sus hijos en casa D. sus padres que le dejaron en herencia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito D. Chepén que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y comercial.

Gloria se dedica a la venta D. ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desD. hace unos un año, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando D. tener mayor demanda D. clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.  

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia brindándole otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
Gloria, 57, is a mother living with her children in her parents’ house that they left her as an inheritance; it has all basic utilities and is located in Chepén District that’s part of La Libertad Department, a zone noted for farming, raising livestock and commerce.

Gloria is a clothes merchant, a business she’s had in her home since about a year.  She sells merchandise to her customers at home and she also brings things on order trying to increase customer demand to earn higher income and meet her family expenses.

Seeing that her business is more and more profitable every day she felt it necessary to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger amounts of clothes and stock her store with innovative items so that her clientele will continue to grow so that she can repay the loan and improve her family’s quality of life offering them other opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, de 36 años, convive con Cledia. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos: Junior, Sarai y Amitai. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruano). La siembra de café, plátanos, es la principal actividad económica de Rafael; junto a su esposa e hijos todos los fines de semana se dedican al cuidado de sus sembríos, los cuales después de cada cosecha los comercializa en las ciudades de La Merced y Villarica, donde viaja constantemente. Ya tiene 6 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y para más adelante está planeando mejorar la calidad de sus frutos, pues desea incursionar en el negocio de las licitaciones, donde podrá abastecer los requerimientos del estado peruano, en los diferentes comedores populares, cárceles y demás instituciones. Además de sentirse contento con el apoyo que le brinda su esposa, quien trabaja embolsando plantitas de café para viveros; según cuenta realiza un promedio de 4 mil a 5 mil bolsas al mes, ahí genera un dinero extra para el hogar. Él pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está aseguro que el trabajo conjunto, compromiso y solidaridad, lograrán que su banco comunal, sea el mejor. Por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes en la obtención de sus objetivos. Rafael de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con la realización de viveros de café, proyectándose para la cosecha del próximo año.
texts.en:
Rafael, 36, lives with Cledia and three (Junior, Sarai and Amitai) of their four children in their own house in Unión Palomar (central Peruvian forest).  Rafael's main business is growing coffee and bananas.  Together they care for the crops every weekend, then at harvest time sell the produce in the cities of La Merced and Villarica, where they travel constantly.  They have been involved in agriculture for six years.  In the future they want to improve the quality of their produce and would like to get involved in bidding as a supplier to official Peruvian social dining rooms, prisons and other institutions.  

Rafael is happy with the support he receives from his wife who packages coffee seedlings for nurseries.  She averages 4,000 to 5,000 bags per month, which generates extra income for the household.  He belongs to the communal bank "La Unión hace la fuerza del Palomar" and this is his second loan through MFP.  He is sure that through joint work, commitment and support the communal bank will become even better.  He is counting on each of you to help him with his goal.  Rafael plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to start the coffee seedling process and plan for next year's harvest.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Merry Grace

texts.en:
Merry Grace is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Merry Grace has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Merry Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Merry Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 45 years old and single with two children, both of whom are in school. She has a business selling tea in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Sabina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to buy a plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a kettle, glasses, and a chair to make tea to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 30 years old and married with two children. She has a business selling soft drinks likes mango juice, lemons and spices in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Hellen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. The extra income will help to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mango juice and lemons to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a divorced woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees for her child. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past seven years; her potential clients are local retailers. She faces the major challenge of government policies on fish sales. She dreams of establishing another fish shop in town. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a freezer and fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and fish for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Milagrosa

texts.en:
Ma. Milagrosa is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living through pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Ma. Milagrosa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 51 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She has a food vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her viand business. Delia has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her viand business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 31 años es madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años. Desde hace 4 años que ella tiene su pulpería, tiene buenos clientes que llegan a comprarle la variedad de productos que ofrece. Ella tiende su negocio desde las 7 la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, Maria está pendiente de los productos que sus clientes le solicitan. Es por que solicita este crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en: Maria De Los Ángeles is 31 years old and a single mother of a child of 9. She has been running a grocery store for the last 4 years and she has loyal customers who come to buy the varied products she sells. She takes care of her business from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. Maria pays attention to the products customers ask her for. This is why she is asking for the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sweets, soft drinks, soups and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, soups and canned goods.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en: Valerie is 25 years old and married to a driver. She sells charcoal and she has been doing this for more than two years. She has asked for the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. She believes that the profits from this business will be used to create savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  BENKADI sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Médine, dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame   AWA  en première position à partir de la gauche et tenant deux courges fait le commerce de condiments.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 paniers de tomate, 3 cartons de cube maggies qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group are mostly married women with an average age of 31, and an average of 4 children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Medine, in the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.
This is their ninth loan to meet their customers’ needs with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Madame Awa, first from the left and holding two squashes, sells condiments.
With her loan, she intends to purchase five baskets of tomatoes, three boxes of Maggi cube that she will retail at the market of Medine in Sikasso. She sells for cash at a permanent stall and from home to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 Francs CFA. Part of which is used to pay the loan and its interest and the other part for her savings. She aims to increase her turnover to better meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 39-year-old modest lady from Vihiga County, Western Kenya.  She is married to Noel and they have three kids.

Alice operates a dressmaking business where she designs clothing for men and women and also does tailoring work. She has been in this trade for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD  which she will use to buy textiles.

She will use the profits to provide for her family and also to expand her business. Her hope is to sustain her business and ensure it expands.

loans.use: To buy textiles for dressmaking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, soda, bottled water, rice, sardines, tuna, salt, coffee, shampoo, vegetables and candy.

loans.name: Qui

texts.en:
Qui is 54 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Qui earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 15 years. 

Qui is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and sweets, to stock her general store.  She hopes this will enable her both to better meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract new customers.  Qui also hopes that, through this loan, her business will generate more revenue, enabling her to improve her family's living conditions and save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and sweets.

loans.name: Walter Augusto

texts.es:
Walter Augusto, él vive en Camaná, Perú, un oasis en el otro modo de largo y seco desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad, destruido la industria del turismo en Camaná, y costando muchos de sus puestos de trabajo, los medios de subsistencia, y los hogares. Pero el resultado de un desempleo es que crea un ambiente preparado para las microfinanzas.  Camaná tiene unas playas preciosas, y en su tiempo libre Walter disfruta de pescar para relajarse un poco;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Walter le agrada mucho es el “Puré de Papas”. Walter  estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar  Periodismo.  Walter es conviviente, su pareja se dedica a la venta de tortas y dulces de manera ambulante, juntos tienen 1 hijo, el cual actualmente  cursa el quinto año de secundaria.
		
"Walter  se dedica al Servicio de Fotografía, se dedica a este trabajo 8 horas diarias, en un día Walter puede atender alrededor de 15 clientes  y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente S/. 35 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 70 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, asi como tambien apoya a su pareja en la venta de su productos, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque entrega sus trabajos con puntualidad. 

Actualmente agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con este apoyo puede  comprar materiales e impresoras para su negocio, esta mejora lo ayudara en tener una impresora más moderna y poder realizar más impresiones que las que hace actualmente y así poder en algunos meses ampliar su local  lo que lo ayudará a tener más ingresos y  cumplir su gran sueño: comprar un terreno para “Construir su vivienda."
texts.en:
Walter Augusto lives in Camaná, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long and dry desert of Sechura that dominates the coast in the Southeast part of the country. Camana has historically been an important tourist destination in Peru, nevertheless, the frequent and  strong earthquakes and tsunamis of the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, destroyed the tourist industry in Camana costing many their jobs, livelihoods and homes. But the result of the unemployment has created an atmosphere prepared for microfinancing. Camana has precious beaches and, in his free time, Walter enjoys fishing to relax a little. In addition, he knows that Peru is known for having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Walter likes is "Pure de Papas" (mashed potatoes). Walter studied up to the fifth year of high school but he would have liked to study journalism. Walter lives with his partner. His spouse is dedicated to selling cakes and sweets on foot. Together they have one child who currently is in his fifth year of high school.

Walter is dedicated to photography service. He does this work eight hours a day. In one day, Walter can attend to approximately 15 customers and this allows him to earn approximately S. 35 daily and, on a good day, he can earn up to S. 70, which helps with some of the additional home bills as well as support his spouse selling her products. He believes that his business is going well because he is very friendly with customers and because he completes his work on time.

Currently, he is very thankful for the Kiva loans since with this support he can purchase materials and printers for his business. This improvement will help him to have a more modern printer and be able to complete more printing jobs than today and in a few months expand his shop which will help him earn more income and fulfill his great dream: to purchase land to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase materials and printers.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 50, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a motorcycle mechanic. 

Lien supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business thirteen years ago. She sells snacks, biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock her general store

loans.name: Gladys Maruja

texts.es: Gladys es un mujer de admirar ya que es una mujer que se desenvuelve en dos labores y una de ellas es una hermosa profesión la cual es madre en un hogar infantil de una entidad que apadrina niños maltratos por sus  padres y también niños huérfanos, Gladys se siente bendecida al ejercer esta profesión que no le genera un solo ingreso para su gasto propio pero dice que la sonrisa de estos niños es suficiente pago, añadido a esto se desempeña como vendedora específicamente de catálogo para cubrir sus gastos propios y familiares, solicita un crédito para realizar unas reformas locativas que el exige la entidad reguladora para seguir operando también con una parte del crédito lo destinara en la compra de surtido para cubrir la demanda de productos que tiene. Su principal sueño es seguir con sus sueños y que esta forma de vida pueda perdurar en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a woman to admire since she is a woman who manages two jobs. One of those is a beautiful profession in which she is mother of a children's home. It is an organization that sponsors orphans and children abused by their parents. Gladys feels blessed to pursue this profession as it not only generates an income for her own spending but she says that the smile of the children is sufficient payment. She adds that she also works as a catalog merchant to help cover her personal and family expenses. 

She is applying for a loan to make building repairs required by the regulating agency in order to continue operating. Another part of the loan will buy supplies to satisfy the demand of her products. She greatest dream is to follow her dreams and this way life with endure over time.

loans.use: to make building repairs to continue operating her nonprofit for children, and to buy merchandise to cover the demand of her products.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
In order to take a job Jacinto asks for 30% of the costs upfront in order to give him the ability to buy the materials for his work. He his is seeking the loan so he may buy more materials prior to receiving his orders. This will speed up the work and increase the quality of his services. He also wants to put a down payment on a tool he needs in his shop.

Jacinto is 37 years old and has 6 children. His oldest son works and contributes to his household. Through the years, Jacinto has been able to support his family with his work and he has also been able to make improvements to his home. He hopes his business will continue to allow him to do achieve this.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy paints and parts for his business

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.en:
The wish to see her family get ahead motivated Martha to open her store. Two years ago she became unemployed, and started selling clothes and used products. Then, she decided to invest her income in imported products. Martha is married. Her husband is a welder, and the money he earns is not enough to support their family. Martha wants to help their family, and to offer a better life to her two-year old child; she found this way to do it.

Martha needs to increase her sales of imported products, and is requesting a loan in the amount of US$925, so she can offer her clients a wider variety of products and better service. Martha needs your support, and thanks you for your generosity.

El deseo de salir adelante con su familia impulsó a Martha a iniciar su propio negocio. Hace dos años quedó desempleada y comenzó a vender ropa y cosas usadas, con el ingreso que obtuvo decidió invertir importaciones. Martha es casada, su esposo trabaja de soldador, el dinero que él obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia. Martha quiere ayudar a su famita y ofrecerle mayor bienestar a su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad, ella encontró esta manera para hacerlo.

Ahora, Martha necesita un préstamo de $925 dólares para incrementar su venta de importaciones para ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad y un mejor servicio. Martha necesita de tu apoyo, y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase imported products

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is married and has three children. He used to work in the fields, but the income he had was insufficient to live on and to pay for the education of his children. Faced by this, he decided 20 years ago to start his own grocery business with the help of his wife. Little bit by little bit, through strength and dedication, they grew the business. Subsequently, they were able to buy a truck to transport their merchandise.

At this moment, Alberto is requesting a loan of $750, that he plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise to expand his assortment, especially in refreshments, juices, sweets, and snacks, since his business is close to a school and these products are in most demand with the students. He commits to repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months.

You can better the standard of living of Alberto and his family. He just wants to continue to work hard and he'll be able to do so thanks to your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto es casado y tiene tres hijos, él se dedicaba a las labores del campo, pero el ingreso que recibía era insuficiente para el sustento y educación de sus hijos, ante esta situación, desde hace 20 años decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes donde recibe la ayuda de su esposa, poco a poco y con base en esfuerzo y dedicación han hecho crecer este negocio, después lograron comprarse una camioneta que utilizan para el traslado de las mercancías.

En estos momentos, Alberto solicita de un crédito por $ 750 dólares, mismos que planea invertir en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido, sobre todo de refrescos, jugos, dulces y botanas, porque su negocio esta muy cerca de una escuela y estos productos son los mas demandados por los niños, él se compromete a regresar este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes mejorar las condiciones de vida de Alberto y su familia, él solo quiere continuar trabajando y puede hacerlo gracias a tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
Shakir is an IDP from Fizuli, an occupied district of Azerbaijan. Shakir is a caring husband and also a father of four children. In 1993, he fled Fizuli to make Baku his new home. In 1996, he launched his idea to start an auto repair business. In 2005, Shakir received his first loan from Normicro Baku. This provided the initial funding to help him build his first small auto services shop.

Just this year, Shakir received a second loan from the same organization and completed building of his shop. Currently, he hopes to borrow a total amount of $1,100 so that he can renovate his current inventory of auto equipment.

loans.use: To purchase materials to renovate auto equipment

loans.name: Martha Mirian

texts.es:
My name is Maria del Carmen and I run a restaurant in my house. I cook a very savory tripe soup. I have run this business for many years and it already provides enough income to help cover my family's living and school costs. I need to buy ingredients for my restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Maria del Carmen cuento con un comerdor, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, preparo una sopa de mondongo que es muy sabrosa, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de estudio de mi familia, necesito abastecer mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, tripe, lard, salt and spices.

loans.name: Anih

texts.en:
Anih is 51 years old and married. She makes and sells an Indonesian salad called “gado-gado”, working from her small shop from 8 in the morning until evening. She also sells other food like crackers, snacks and some vegetables at the shop.

Her husband passed away some time ago, so she is the only one left to fight for her and her child's lives. Anih is a member of MBK and is reqesting a loan so that she can earn more income for her child’s education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Activas". She lives in the housing project Gentleman of Miracles, Pachacutec MzMLt. 06, Calleria district in the state of Ucayali. She is 31 years old, and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough to cover their housing costs. For this reason, Maria Elizabeth, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/300.00 (US$100.00) decided to start a small business (sale of chickens).

Currently she has a small shop where she sells chickens (birds for consumption). She gets up at 1:00A.M. to go and purchase her products, and at 5:00A.M. opens her store. The store usually closes at 1:00P.M., when she returns to her home to make lunch for her small children. Later she rests and prepares for the next day's routine.

With this loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (US$334.00 approx.), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will increase her regular purchase of chickens (she will purchase 70 chickens a day), to increase her sales and earn more income.

Maria Elizabeth is happy to have three healthy children, and to see her business prosper, since it is a very important job for her, as it allows her to achieve the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Activas”, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Señor de los Milagros Jr. Pachacutec Mz M Lt. 06, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Maria Elizabeth, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide poner un pequeño negocio (venta de pollos). En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de pollos (aves de consumo). Se levanta a la 1 de la mañana para ir a comprar sus productos y a las 5 a.m. empieza la atención en su puesto. La venta normalmente termina a las 1 p.m., luego se dirige a su domicilio para hacer el almuerzo de sus pequeños hijos para después descansar y prepararse para la rutina del día siguiente. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 334.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, incrementara la compra habitual de pollos (comprará 70 pollos diarios), para que su venta pueda aumentar y de esa manera tener mayores ingresos. Maria Elizabeth está muy contenta de tener sanos a sus 3 hijos y ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, así alcanza el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for consumption

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.en:
Martha is in her early thirties, and she is a single mother with six school-going children (four boys and two girls). Martha runs a bakery which she started eight months ago, with a loan she had taken from FSMA. She used the funds wisely and she was able to repay the loan on time. Currently, people in the neighborhood visit her house all day long to purchase her mouth-watering cakes, pies, and delectable desserts.

With this loan, Martha will rent a small locale next to her house, and there she’ll run the bakery. She hopes her business will become the best confectioner’s shop of her community.

loans.use: rental of a small locale to run a bakery out of

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is 46 years old. She is married with five children. She owns a restaurant. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2004. She needs a loan amount of $425 to buy more chairs and also drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and drinks for my restaurant

loans.name: Rosa Judita

texts.es:
Rosa S. is a very hard-working woman from the Somotillo zone in the city of Chinandega. For the past 15 years she has worked raising livestock such as pigs. She fattens them with concentrated feed and cares for them as they mature in order to later butcher and sell the meat.

Rosa is married with four children and is working to provide for their education and shelter. In order to continue in her work, Mrs. S. has requested a loan from Ceprodel in order to improve her economic situation and thereby continue caring for her children who need her so much. She has successfully repaid 5 loans through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa S. es una dama muy trabajadora originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde hace 15 años se dedica al negocio de crianza de ganado como lo son los cerdos el cual los alimenta por medio de alimentos concentrados y cuida de su desarrollo para luego destazarlos y comercializarlos.

Es madre casada y con cuatro hijos que mantener brindándole estudios y un techo digno donde habitar. Para lograr llevar a cabo su trabajo, la señora S. acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica y de esta manera lograr continuar manteniendo a sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan. Su record crediticio actualmente es de 5 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Raising of livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
B. Elizabeth is a trader who sells clothing materials. She is married and has 2 children. She is working very hard to support the family. She wishes to increase sales, but lacks funding to do so.

She is asking for $425 as an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: San Andresanas 1 Group

texts.es:
The San Andresanas women come from a small, friendly town called San Andres Semetabaj located on the shores of Lake Atitlán.

The San Andresanas are going to use the money they borrow in different ways. Nine of the women are going to purchase thread to make traditional woven items. Another four women are going to buy thread to make beautiful embroideries. One is going to invest in a small hair salon. Another woman is going to invest in cosmetics that are sold through catalogs. Meanwhile, two others are going to use their money to purchase American clothing to resell.

This group of women believes that their businesses are doing well and it’s for that reason that they want to continue to invest in them. They are confident that with the money they receive, their businesses will grow and they will have the ability to repay the debt without any problems.

Within this group there are three women who are very enterprising because they have two businesses. Two of them work principally making and selling woven goods and in addition to that have a small store that helps with their families’ income. Similarly, one of the women has a hair salon. She currently has a person that helps her with the salon. The fact that a micro business has an employee is an indication that the business is doing well.

The women believe that ever sense they signed up with Friendship Bridge and received their first loan, their family finances have changed. Now they can help with family expenses because they can buy supplies and school uniforms when their children need them. Besides that, they can buy food with their money when they think it is necessary.

The San Andresanas are happy to work together in a communal bank because they can share. The dream of many of the women is that of having a successful business because that way they can leave an inheritance to their children. We must lend a hand to this group of extraordinary women so they can achieve this dream that’s so pure.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres San Andresanas provienen D. un pequeño y acogedor pueblo llamado San Andres Semetabaj, que está ubicado a las orillas del lago D. Atitlán.

Las San Andresanas van a utilizar su crédito D. manera distintas. Nueve mujeres van a invertir su crédito en la compra D. hilo para elaborar tejidos tradicionales. Otras cuatro mujeres van a invertir el crédito en comprar hilo para elaborar bellos bordados. Una va a invertir en su pequeña peluquería. Una van a invertir en cosméticos que venden por medio D. los catálogos. Mientras que otras dos van a invertir su crédito en la compra D. ropa americana para su reventa.

Este grupo D. señoras creen que les va bien en sus negocios, es por eso que ellas quieren seguir invertir en ellos. Ellas tienen confianza que con el crédito que van a recibir su negocio va a crecer y van a tener la capacidad D. repagar la deuda sin ningún problema. Dentro D. este grupo hay tres señoras que son muy emprendedoras ya que ellas tienen dos negocios. Las dos elaboran y venden tejidos principalmente y encima D. ese negocio tienen una pequeña tienda que les ayuda con el ingreso D. la familia. Asimismo, una señora tiene una peluquería. Actualmente ella cuenta con una persona que la ayuda en la peluquería. El hecho que una microempresaria tenga una empleada es un indicio D. que su negocio le va bien.

Las mujeres creen que desD. que se enrolaron con Friendship Bridge y recibieron su primer crédito las finanzas D. la familia han cambiado. Ahora ellas pueden ayudar en los gastos D. la familia, ya que ellas pueden comprar los materiales y uniformes D. colegio a sus hijos cuando ellos lo necesitan. Además, pueden comprar alimentos con su dinero cuando ellas piensen que es necesario.

Las San Andresanas se sienten contentas D. trabajar juntas en un banco comunal porque pueden compartir. El sueño D. mucha D. las mujeres es el D. tener un negocio exitoso para que así ellas puedan dejarle una herencia a sus hijos. Hay que darles una mano a este grupo D. extraordinarias mujeres para que así ellas puedan lograr este sueño tan puro.

loans.use: Purchase thread to make traditional woven items and embroideries, cosmetics, American clothing for resale and products for a hair salon

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Not willing to accept perpetual poverty, in 2002 Ms. M. Thi Nguyen and her husband, Thang Van Nguyen, joined the Fund with the goal of borrowing money to expand their business.  In the first year, since they were not yet experienced with the repayment method of weekly payments, they opted to borrow 700,000 VND to buy two breeding pigs.  During the day her husband works to have money for the weekly payment and in a short time the first loan was repaid and at the same time the couple had saved a small amount of money from selling pigs.  Seeing that borrowing loans and repaying on a weekly basis fit well with the needs of the family, in subsequent funding rounds the family boldly borrowed larger amounts to expand the livestock operations.  Under the more favorable conditions of the business operations, the family’s finances have improved day by day, they have been able to afford more everyday conveniences.  The couple has two children, one grown and one still in school.  In this round of funding the family is requesting 9,000,000 VND to continue investing in raising pigs.  Their average revenue from the livestock and other jobs is 3,500,000 VND per month.
Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.
Không chịu chấp nhận sự nghèo túng mãi. Năm 2002 chị Nguyễn Thị M. bàn bạc cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Thặng, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương, với mục đích vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế, năm đầu tiên do chưa quen cách trả tiền theo tuần nên anh chị chỉ vay với mức vốn 700.000đ mua 2 con lợn giống, hàng ngay anh phải đi làm thuê để có tiền trả tuần, chẳng mấy chốc vòng vốn lần 1 đã hoàn thành xong và lúc đó anh chị cũng đã dành giụm được chút vốn nho nhỏ từ việc bán lợn. Nhận thấy việc vay vốn trả theo tuần là phù hợp với điều kiện gia đình, các vòng tiếp theo gia đình anh chị đã mạnh giạn vay vốn cao hơn mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi, từ những dự án chăn nuôi phù hợp đó kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một thay đổi, mua sắm được nhiệu tiện nghi phục vụ đời sống hàng ngày, anh chị có 2 con, 1 con đã trưởng thành và 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân từ chăn nuôi và làm thêm: 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: feed pigs

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna S., 54, is married and the mother of 6 children, three of whom are married daughters. She has been a member of the village bank Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar for six and a half years. She wants to bolster her business by buying palm oil in Yarang and selling it in Ziguinchor. Maimouna is attempting to improve living conditions and the health of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Maimouna S., 54 ans mariée mère de 06 enfants dont 03 filles mariées est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant de l’huile de palme à Yarang pour le revendre à Ziguinchor. Maimouna cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
buying palm oil for re-sale

Acheter de l'huile de palme et revendre

loans.name: Mario Ander

texts.es:
Description Mario is 37 years old and is the father of 2 children who are in primary school. He lives with his wife Liliana who supports him very much, especially with his daily work. Mario is a master baker, and he has a small oven in his home where he prepares and bakes his bread. He takes it to sell to different places in the area on his tricycle, which is an activity that he has carried out for the past 4 years and he is happy that many people like his bread. His daily routine is to wake up at 3 a.m. to prepare his breads and when they are ready at 6 a.m. he takes them to sell until there are no more, which is between 10 and 11 a.m. approximately. He works to support his family and above all the education of his children. He wants to expand his business, buy another tricycle and also invest in ingredients for the elaboration of his product. In the future he wants to be a great exporter of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Mario tiene 37 años de edad y es padre de 2 hijos que cursan estudios primarios, el vive con su esposa Liliana, quien lo apoya mucho, sobre todo con su trabajo diario. Mario es maestro panadero, cuenta con un pequeño horno dentro de su vivienda donde hace sus panes, parte de preparar y hornear pan, los lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona en su triciclo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años y se siente alegre de que mucha gente deguste sus panes. Su rutina diaria es levantarse a las 3 de la mañana a preparar sus panes, cuando están listos que es a las 6 de la mañana los lleva vender hasta que se acabe que será más o menos entre las 10 u 11 de la mañana. Trabaja para el sustento diario de su familia y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos. Quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, comprarse otro triciclo y desde luego implementar con insumos para la elaboración de su producto. En el futuro quiere ser un gran exportador de pan.

loans.use: To expand his business and buy another tricycle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 30 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con su tres hijos Yudith, Luzdelia de 3 y Johan de 1. Tiene un taller en su casa para la fabricación de pequeños estantes, los cuales elabora en base a fierros forrados con plástico.Juana trabaja todos los días en la fabricación de estos muebles, los cuales son bien cotizados por el público juliaqueño, al día produce de 2 a 4 muebles para comercializar, con ayuda de su primo, quien la ayuda en el trabajo. Por otro lado, también tiene deberes con sus hijos pequeños, a los cuales debe atender cumpliendo el doble rol de madre y comerciante, el cual la deja exhausta, pero saca fuerzas de flaqueza para seguir trabajando y alcanzar sus metas.
Juana trabaja para que sus hijos sean felices, para darles las comodidades que ella no tuvo y que logren ser profesionales.
Con el dinero solicitado comprará materia prima para elaborar sus estantes y vender mucho más, para que en el futuro su pequeño negocio de mejores frutos y tener un taller más grande, con muchos más trabajadores.
texts.en:
Juana is 30 years old and separated from her partner, and lives with her three children, Yudith, Luzdela, 3, and Johan, 1. She has a workshop in her house where she makes small shelves from iron covered with plastic. Juana works every day making this furniture, which is highly valued by the Juliacan public. Every day she makes between 2 and 4 pieces to sell with the help of her cousin, who helps her with this work. On the other hand, she also has a duty to her young children, whom she needs to attend to while playing the dual role of mother and businesswoman. This leaves her exhausted, but she finds strength out of weakness to keep working and reach her goals. Juana works so her children can be happy, in order to give them the comforts that she never had, and so they can be professionals. With the requested loan she will buy raw materials to make her shelves and sell many more, so that in the future her small business will bear better fruit and she can have a larger workshop, with many more workers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make shelves that she will sell

loans.name: Clavel Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Clavel” trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer en el centro focal de Villa Adela hace cuatro años. En su mayoría son casadas y con familias numerosas. Todas se dedican al comercio;algunas de dedican a la venta de  variedad de ropa y medias, que son comercializadas en los yungas,por otro lado, Flora vende sandalias, pantuflas y papel higiénico; Naldy, Isabel y Ross tienen tiendas de barrio. Cuentan que ahora es imprescindible que ellas tengan un negocio propio ya que los sueldos de sus esposos no son suficientes para mantener a sus familias, ya que las necesidades de sus niños crecen cada día más.
Necesitan de capital para comprar productos al por mayor, de esta manera sus ganancias serán mayores
texts.en:
The “Clavel” (Carnation) association has been working in conjunction with Pro-Mujer in Villa Adela for four years. Most of its members are married and have big families. They all have their own businesses. Some sell a variety of clothing and hosiery in the yungas—the Eastern part of the Andes Mountains. Flora, on the other hand, sells sandals, slippers, and bathroom tissue, while Naldy, Isabel, and Rossy run neighborhood general stores. They say that it is imperative that they have their own businesses because their husbands’ wages are insufficient to support their families, and their children grow more and more each day. They need capital to purchase wholesale products so that they may earn bigger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en: Bahrom is a master in baking national bread. He and his wife bake national bread and sell it at the market. As baking national bread is very hard work, Bahrom makes it and his wife sells it at the market. They have a son who studies at the university. They pay a lot of money for his studies. So to earn more money to support him they have to work hard. Bahrom wishes that some day his son will become a good specialist. He wants to borrow money to purchase more flour and ingredients for baking national bread.

loans.use: Bahrom would like to expanding his business baking national bread.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ella tiene una gran trayectoria en las actividades agrícolas, pues son 50 años de haber  cultivado la tierra y de criar animales, junto a su esposo ha podido sostener a sus 3  hijos que ahora son personas independientes, con los años que han pasado se siente contenta de haber educado a sus hijos y solo le queda continuar para  seguir cultivando la tierra  para el sostén de ella y de su esposo, ambos cultivan maíz y papa, que son los principales productos de su tierra. También se dedican a la crianza de animales, principalmente la vaca y el toro que les sirve para la venta. Adicionalmente, vende comida en su propia casa. Es la primera vez que solicita préstamo en MFP, pero está avalada por su banco comunal, además tiene buenos antecedentes. Teofila solicita este préstamo que le servirá para preparar su tierra de cultivo con sacos de abono y también para poder seguir impulsando su pequeño negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Teofila is 59 years old and she lives with her husband and her son. She has great stature in the agricultural field having spent the last 50 years cultivating the field and raising livestock. Together with her husband she has been able to support their 3 children, who are now independent. With the years that have gone by she feels fulfilled for having educated their children, and now the only thing that's left is to keep cultivating the fields for hers and her husband support. They both harvest corn and potatoes, which are the main products of their country. They also raise livestock, mostly cows and bulls that are later sold. In addition, they also sell food from their own home. It is the first time that they request a loan from MFP (Kiva field partner). She has good standing with her community bank and she has a good credit history. Teofila requests this loan to prepare the fields for harvest with fertilizer and also to keep her small food service running.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Dame A. Colette est née le 16 janvier 1976 à porto novo, elle est veuve et à 02 enfants à sa charge. Elle vend du riz dans un collège privé de la place, parèllèlement à cette activité elle vend de la farine de manioc, le kilo de riz et de l'huile à la maison. Pour couvrir toute sa clientèle et vu  aussi le nombre des élèves qui ne cesse  d'augmenter chaque année et particulièrement cette rentrée, elle a du solliciter ce pret.
texts.en:
Mrs Colette Agbaosi was born on January 16th, 1976 in Porto Novo. She is a widow and supports 2 children. She sells rice on site at a private college. Besides this, she also sells manioc flour, kilos of rice and oil from her house. She is requesting this loan to keep up with her growing clientele and students, whose numbers keep increasing every year, especially this school year.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 sacks of rice, oil and manioc flour for resale

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 19 años, vive con sus padres y su hermana en una casa arrendada. Junto a su madre, desde hace más de 3 años, vienen dedicándose intensamente a la  venta de prendas que ellas mismas producen, tejen diversos artículos como chalecos, gorras, vestidos para niñas, chalinas, entre otros. Por las mañanas Ángela estudia y por las tardes teje, ella ofrece lo que produce a sus amistades más cercanas y sus tiempos libres ofrece de casa en casa sus tejidos. Con esta actividad ella y su madre generan más ingresos para su casa y ella tranquilamente puede solventar sus estudios. Ángela disfruta de realizar esta actividad, sobre todo por las utilidades que le genera y porque es una distracción. Su meta es producir mayor cantidades y tener una tienda donde pueda exponer y vender sus trabajos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado, en el primer ciclo, una joven muy responsable y dinámica que alienta a los integrantes de su banco comunal a trabajar de esta misma forma, unidos. Ángela está solicitando esta cantidad para invertirla en la compra de lana al por mayor, de diversos colores,  así como también, para cubrir los gastos de transporte de sus prendas a los distintos lugares que los lleva a ofrecer.
texts.en:
Ángela is 19 years old and lives with her parents and sister in a rented house. She and her mother, for more than 3 years, have sold clothing that they produce. They weave diverse garments, such as vests, caps, dresses for girls, scarves, etc. In the mornings, Ángela studies, and in the afternoons, she weaves. She offers what she produces to her closest friends, and in her free-time, she offers her products door-to-door. With this activity, she and her mother make more money for their home, and she can finish her studies. Ángela enjoys pursuing this activity, above all for the profits that she makes and because it is a distraction. Her goal is to produce larger quantities and have a store where she can display and sell her products. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated, in her first loan, that she is a responsible and dynamic young woman, which inspires the members of the community bank to work together in the same way. Ángela is requesting the loan so that she can buy wool of different colors at wholesale. In this way, she will also cover her transportation costs when she goes to different places to sell her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of wool

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. R., 30, lives in a cute village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is married with four children who are all students. She currently sells groceries from her house. Her husband's name is Torng he is 38 years old and earns a living by cultivating rice crop. R.'s investment is running smoothly and she has gained a lot of  profit from her grocery selling. The grocery selling is an important source of income for R.. In order to make the business successful, R. has applied for a loan to purchase a variety of groceries to store and then re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase variety of grocery to store and then re-sell

loans.name: Los Alamos De La Estación Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denominado “LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION”;  En este grupo tenemos a un total de 13 socios, todos ellos naturales de la comunidad de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis;, estos socios realizan diferentes actividades.
Su principal actividad es el cultivos de papas, maíz, hortalizas, verduras, también están dedicados a la ganadería ellos compran animales mayores como son las vacas y toros, para el engorde y la producción de lácteos y la venta posterior de los animales vacunos, otro sector de nuestros socios especialmente las socias mujeres venden comidas elaboradas por ellas mismas en el mercado central, puesto que Urcos es un paradero obligatorio para los buses y automóviles con dirección a la ciudad de Arequipa y Puno.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos por el préstamo que se les otorga y se comprometen al pago total de la deuda y en el plazo determinado, ellos valoran la creación de estos bancos comunales de ayuda social, por ser esta una zona humilde y se comprometen a hacer crecer su capital, demostrando que valió la pena darles la oportunidad y creer en ellos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Los Alamos de la Estacion”. This group has 13 members, all of which are natives of the community called Urcos in the Quispicanchis province. These bank members all have different businesses. Their most common business is the cultivation of potatoes, corn, and vegetables. They also work with livestock, the production of dairy products and the subsequent sale of the livestock. Another business sector of the communal bank members, and in particular the women, is the sale of self-produced food in the central market, since Urcos is an obligatory stop for busses and cars that are traveling to Arequipa or Puno. Our bank members are very thankful for the loan and they are committed to the full repayment of the debt and within the term of the loan. They value the creation of these communal banks for social help. As they live in a humble area, they are committed to make their capital grow, showing that it was worth giving them the opportunity and believing in them.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy manure, fertilizer, bovine cattle, and products for the food sales

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene M. is a trader. She sells goods like maize and gari in Elmina. She has seven dependents and is not married. She has received an education through primary school. She uses cassava in preparing her gari for sale. Magdalene has been in this business since 1999. She would use the money she gets to expand her business, then use the profit she earns to further her children’s education and also use the rest to pay the utility bills of her family.

loans.use: She would use the money she gets to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and tapioca

loans.name: Amina

texts.es:
AMINA G. SALDAÑA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en pasaje Julio C. Tello. en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 23 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su pareja es técnico dental.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes  y el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres como azúcar, arroz, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Cuenta con muchos lientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará 3 cajas de leche, 2 bolsas de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz y mas víveres  para ampliar su  bodega.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Amina G. S. belongs to the “Mujeres Shipibas” communal bank. She lives on Julio C. Tello street in the city of Pucallpa. She is 23 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is a dental technician. She began a small grocery store and with the first loan of 300 PEN, she bought staples such as sugar, rice, noodles, and other basic products. She has many customers and her business has been growing. Amina has been able to help her family and the grocery store business has improved. With this loan of 1,200 PEN, she will buy 3 boxes of milk, 2 bags of sugar, 1 sack of rice, and more staples with which to expand her store. “Manuela Ramos is a non-governmental organization that helps a large number of families with small loans that allow the women of this area to begin or improve their businesses, and I am very happy with this help,” she explains.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of milk, sugar, rice, and other staples.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is divorced with six dependents and has received no formal education. For three years she has worked as a trader selling flour, millet, sugar and oil at Siwdo near Cape Coast. Mary uses her income to pay for her family's various expenses including household bills. 

Mary will use her loan as extra capital for her business in the trading of cooked food. She plans to reinvest her newly gained profits.

loans.use: As extra capital for her business in the trading of cooked food.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS.

SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA FULLER, DESDE AL AÑO 2002.

COMENZO CON EL NEGOCIO POR QUE NECESITABA UN INGRESO EXTRA, PARA PODER APOYAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

COMENZO CON LA VENTA CON FAMILIARES Y AMISTADES, LE HA HIDO MUY BIEN CON ESTE NEGOCIO, TODO GRACIAS A LA SERIEDAD Y BUEN TRATO CON QUE MANEJA A SUS CLIENTES.

AHORA PIDE AL APOYO PARA COMPRAR NUEVA MERCANCIA, PARA PODER OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES LO MEJOR.
texts.en:
Amanda is 30 years old, is married, and has two children. She has dedicated herself to the purchase and sale of Fuller beauty products since 2002. She started this business because she needed extra income to be able to help with household expenses. She began by selling to family and friends, and this business has been going very well thanks to the seriousness and good treatment with which she deals with clients. She now asks for support to purchase new merchandise to be able to offer her clients the best.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim R. is 38 years old and resides in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are vegetables wholesalers. Every morning, she and her husband go to the province market to buy vegetables and then bring them to sell in the local market. On average, they make around USD $15 in revenue each day. This couple has four children, three of whom are in school and one helps her to sell vegetables. Sim R. would like a loan of USD $600 to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina G. is a native of the island village of Buhangin, Buhangin, Rizal province. She is still single and living with her old parents. She is 58 years old and fighting against poverty for her family.

In 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was motivated to join ASHI by the hope of bringing her family out of poverty. She is a busy fish vendor in their village and in the town market. But she is getting old now to still be doing the fish vending business. Currently on her fifth loan, she wants to borrow 25,000 pesos to use in the resale business. This loan will pay for 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar and 50 sacks of charcoal--all for resale.

With this new business of hers, she is hoping to have more time to stay at home to take good care of her parents and still keep her business. She wants to renovate their house and make it more durable.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar and 5 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio G. is from the village of Cartagena. He is 40 years old. Lucio is married and has one small child. To make a living, Lucio provides transportation services to local community members. Lucio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2001, Lucio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Lucio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair  the vehicle that he uses in the business. This will be Lucio's fifth loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle that he uses for his transport service

loans.name: Marianita De Jesus

texts.es:
Marianita vive en Quinta Chica, C. las Chorreras, en la ciudad de Cuenca;  tiene 44 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 23, 22, años de edad  fruto de su unión matrimonial, todos son solteros, trabajan y estudian, tiene casa propia y su marido es un gran apoyo en el hogar.

Es costurera  trabaja elaborando delantales, pero también se dedica al comercio de productos para la belleza de la mujer como son los cosméticos  de Yanbal, es vendedora ambulante y recorre todos los mercados de la ciudad o donde se encuentran las ferias, su horario de trabajo es todos los días  de 8 a.m. a 12 p.m.

Cuando están buenas las ventas agradece a Dios por el buen día de trabajo y cuando están malas la ventas se resigna a no llevar todos los alimentos a casa.

Marianita es un miembro del Banco Comunal Las Estrellitas lo conforman un grupo de 11 socias, que se dedican al comercio, ellas viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca como son muy buenas amigas todas decidieron formar responsablemente el Banco Comunal, se llevan muy bien  entre todos y se respaldan mutuamente, porque desean el bienestar de todas ellas y la superación de cada una.

Marianita para fabricar sus delantales compra la materia prima como es tela, corosiles, hilo etc. y trabaja en un taller pequeño en su casa, el préstamo que realiza es para comprar material para su negocio y la compra de una maquina overlock, que le hace mucha falta, también desea ampliar el surtido de productos femeninos como son los cosméticos para sus clientas.

Su sueño es llegar a tener una fábrica para ser una productora y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marianita lives in Quinta Chica on Chorreras street in the city of Cuenca. She is 44 and married. She and her husband have three children, ages 25, 23, and 22. All of the children are single, work, and go to school. She has her own house, and her husband is a big help at home. She is a seamstress, and she makes aprons. She also sells women’s beauty products like Yanbal cosmetics. Her sales are ambulatory. She goes to all of the markets in the city or where there are fairs. Her work schedule is from 8 a.m. until 12 p.m. every day. When sales are good she thanks God for the good work day. When sales are bad she is resigned to not bringing all of the food home. Marianita is a member of the Las Estrellitas Community bank is made up of 11 members who devote themselves to commerce. They live in different places in the city of Cuenca. As they are all good friends, they decided to responsibly form the community bank. They get along very well with each other, and they support each other. They wish for the well being of all of them, and they hope that each one excels. To make her aprons Marianita buys raw material like fabric, synthetic leather, and thread, etc. She works in a small shop in her house. The loan is to buy material for her business and to buy an Overlock machine, which she really needs. She also wishes to expand her stock of feminine products like cosmetics for her customers. Her dream is to have a factory in order to be a producer and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material like thread, fabric, etc., an Overlock machine, and more Yanbal products for her customers

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy C., 28 (pictured in front of her grocery store), and her husband, Mr. Oem Mony, 31, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2003 and have two young sons. 
 	
Thavy has been selling grocery in her village for 6 years. Her husband has been a teacher for 10 years. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase more grocery items for expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her stock.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es una persona muy alegre, tiene 39 años y vive con sus 3 hijos; Jean Pierre (19), Martín (14) y Ángel (13) en su casa propia. Desde algunos años atrás se ha venido dedicando a la venta de repuestos de vehículos, pero sobre todo a la conversión del motor a gas natural. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, pues el gas natural es mucho más económico que otros combustibles y es ecológico, por lo que su clientela va en aumento. Sofía se siente muy feliz porque sabe que irá progresando cada día más con ayuda de sus hijos, y poniéndole todo el empeño podrá mejorarlo y crecer como empresaria exitosa.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual en todos sus pagos, además se lleva muy bien con todas las personas de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más equipos y repuestos para vender, pues debe satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sofia is a very happy person, 39 years old, and lives with her 3 children: Jean Pierre (19), Martín (14), and Ángel (13), in her own house. For the past few years she dedicated herself to the sale of car parts, but mostly she works on converting motors to consume natural gas. This is a very profitable business, since natural gas is much cheaper than other combustibles and is also ecological; because of this her clientele is on the rise. Sofia feels very happy because she knows that every day she is progressing in her ability to help her children and she knows that by working hard she will able to improve and develop as a successful businesswoman.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, she is very punctual with her payments, and also gets along very well with all the group members. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more equipment and spare parts to sell, given that she has to satisfy her clients’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and equipment for automobiles.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
This young man is single and lives in Fuzuli region. He is enjoying with his cattle breeding business. He has been in cattle breeding business for 4 years. 
Galib was born in 1989. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Saumu Nyongesa

texts.en:
Saumu is 34 years old and is blessed with three children. Her business is located at th Likuyani market center.

She was introduced to KADET by a business partner. With the loan she is requesting from KADET, she intends to buy food, including maize, beans and vegetables. Her future plans are to grow her business and be able to feed her family.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy food for resale in a market

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo is 40 years old and married with three children. She sells hair extensions, hair relaxer, and drinks at retail prices, and she is also a hair stylist. She has been in this business for a long time. Most of the challenges she faces in her business are to do with the very high transport costs to the market.

This is the high season for Titilayo's business and she hopes to meet her customers' requirements. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Vida Plena (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Vida Plena se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo la capital del Azuay, es reconocida por sus escritores, Cuenca es la fusión de tres culturas ricas en simbolismos, tradición y arte: Cañari, Inca y Española, su gente es cálida, amable y muy alegre como nuestras socias.

La Sra. Amarilis Villacreces es socia del banco comunal Vida Plena, vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 20 años de edad, se encuentra viviendo en unión libre y en su relación ha procreado 2 hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad, su esposo trabaja en la venta de productos Onmilife, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Amarilis trabaja en la venta de productos Omnilife, lleva en este negocio hace 4 años y nos comenta que le va bien por lo que tiene algunos conocidos, trabaja recorriendo y no tiene sitio fijo para su trabajo, como tampoco tiene un horario fijo para su trabajo, se lleva con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal ya que son compañeras de trabaja también, se encuentra en su primer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de mas producto Omnilife, su meta es de llegar a ser una vendedora diamante la categoría más alta de  en su negocio.

La Sra.
