Sybella B. es socia del banco comunal Vida Plena, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 34 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 4 años y ha tomada por la falta de comprensión, ha procreado 4 hijos de 13, 9, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio Asunción y sus tres hijos estudian en la escuela Alborada, su esposo no ayuda económicamente a sus hijos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres.

Sybella trabaja en el negocio de venta de productos Omnilife, lleva trabajando en este negocio 6 años y nos comenta que le va muy bien, capacita a nuevas socias y recorre por la ciudad con sus productos, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m. todos los días de la semana, se lleva con todas las compañeras de la banca comunal, es su primer crédito y nos comenta que ya fue socia con otro bankito y ahora formo un grupo nuevo, con el préstamo que la fundación espoir le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de mas producto, su meta es de llegar a tener la categoría diamante el nivel más alto de su negocio y llegar a tener una casa propia.

La Sra. Eva Peña es socia del banco comunal Vida Plena, vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 40 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha procreado 2 hijos de 18 y 5 años de edad, su hija estudia en la Universidad Estatal y su hijo estudia en el jardín de infantes Abelardo Tamariz Crespo, su esposo trabaja como chofer de su propio taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Eva trabaja en la venta de productos Omnilife, lleva 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, trabaja unas 8 horas diarias, recorre toda la ciudad vendiendo sus productos y cuenta con una clientela fija, se lleva bien con todas las socias de la banca comunal, es su primer crédito con la fundación espoir y su préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos Onmilife, su sueño es de poder tener su casa propia y viajar por varias partes del mundo.
texts.en:
The “Vida Plena” (Full Life) Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. It is renowned for its writers. Cuenca is the fusion of three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition, and art: Cañari, Incan, and Spanish. The people are warm, friendly, and as happy as our members.

Sra. Amarilis Villacreces is a member of the Vida Plena Communal Bank and lives in Cuenca. She is 20 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (age 3 and 1). Her husband sells Omnilife products. They do not own a home, so they are currently renting.

Amarilis also sells Omnilife products and has been doing this for four years. She says her business is doing well because she has many acquaintances. She travels around for her work so she has neither a fixed location nor a set schedule that she follows. Amarilis gets along well with the other members of her Communal Bank since they must work together. This is her first loan and she will use it to buy more Omnilife products. Her goal is to become a diamond level sales representative, which is the highest category for this particular business.

Sra. Sybella B. is a member of the Vida Plena Communal Bank and lives in Cuenca. She is 34 years old and has been divorced for 4 years due to irreconcilable differences. She has 4 children, ranging in age from 6 to 13. Her oldest daughter is a student at Asunción High School while the other three children attend the Alborada School. Her ex-husband does not support the children financially. She does not own a home, so she lives with her parents.

Sybella has been selling Omnilife products for six years and says she is doing quite well. She trains new associates and travels throughout the city selling her products. Her work schedule is from 8am to 8pm every day of the week. She gets along well with the other Communal Bank members. This is her first loan. Sybella says she was a member of another Communal Bank and has now formed a new group. This loan from Fundación ESPOIR will be used to buy more products. Her goal is to reach the diamond level category so that she can buy her own home.

Sra. Eva Peña is a member of the Vida Plena Communal Bank and lives in Cuenca. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children (ages 18 and 5). Her daughter is a student at the state university, while her son attends kindergarten at the Abelardo Tamariz Crespo School. Her husband is a taxi driver. They do not own a home, so they are currently renting.

Eva has been selling Omnilife products for five years and says she is doing very well. She works eight hours each day, travels throughout the city selling her products, and has an established customer base. She gets along well with all the members of the Communal Bank. This is her first loan with Fundación ESPOIR and will use the funds to buy more Omnilife products. Her dream is to have a house of her own and travel to different parts of the world.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has owned a car painting shop since 2000. He’s 24 years old, single and living with his parents. He has great demand for his shop thus he wants to  take out  a  loan of US$ 1000 to buy more tools and enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: buy more tools

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn T. is from the village of Sapang Ama in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and married, and has one child. To make a living, Jenalyn owns and operates a video entertainment business with four videoke units. She also owns a sari-sari (variety) store in the local community. Jenalyn has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Jenalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Jenalyn is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to buy another videoke unit and to use as additional working capital. This will be Jenalyn's 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: To buy another videoke machine

loans.name: Sabanoh Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Sabanoh Group. Sabanoh group members are petty businesspeople in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to give a boost to their businesses. With this loan, they can add more goods to their stalls. Consequently, this will attract more customers to their businesses, and they will make more sales and better profit, thereby improving their living conditions.

The leader of this group is John T. who is on the left in the photo. John Thollley, 45 years old, was born in a place called Makali, in northern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman and 3 of their children are attending school – 1 in secondary school, 2 in primary school; the eldest is now on his own. John makes a living through selling flour, rubber bowls, and cups. He is been doing this business for 5 years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy bags of flour, dozens of rubber bowls, and dozens of cups to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy bags of flour, dozens of rubber bowls, and dozens of cups to add to his current stock

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Esta señora se llama Luz Marina C. Bermúdez,  nuestra institución le ha apoyado desde el año 2007, con la cinco créditos en estos dos años, cuenta con 44 años de edad, es soltera con tres hijos, dos mayores y un menor de edad, esta señora estuvo por el país de Costa Rica por espacio de siete meses buscando nuevos horizontes, pero dado que la situación y las condiciones de este país no fueron muy fructíferas para ella, decidió volver a su país para trabajar nuevamente en su negocio. El negocio de esta señora es venta de frijoles cocidos, tortillas y leña, en su negocio le ayudan dos  de sus hijos, los que además de palmear las tortillas le ayudan en la venta de los otros productos, tiene 30 años de experiencia y de contar con este negocio.
texts.en:
This lady's name is Luz Marina C. Bermúdez. CEPRODEL has helped her since 2007 with 5 credits in these 2 years. She is 44 years old, a single mother of three children, two of them of age and a minor. She went to Costa Rica for seven months looking for a new horizon but given the situation and conditions of that country, which weren't fruitful, she decided to come back to her country to work again in her business. She sells cooked beans, tortillas and wood. Two of her children help her in the business, both at patting the tortillas into shape and selling the other products. She has 30 years of experience at this business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies: corn, wood and beans

loans.name: Deona Ann Mejia's Group

texts.en:
Deona Ann M. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 30 years old. Deona Ann is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Deona Ann M.'s Group.

Deona Ann is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Deona Ann owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Deona Ann has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Deona Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deona Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Deona Ann is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Deona Ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Florencia, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 44 años  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 12, 7 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la docencia ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco y siempre que puede darse una escapadita se viene a su lugar de origen a ver a sus parientes y sus cosas aquí en Coya, ella trabaja en el ministerio de educación y solicita el préstamo para hacer un pequeño negocio está pensando invertir en dinero en dos posibles negocios que ella nos dará a conocer más adelante, ya que tiene la creencia de que si avisa antes es posible de que no se le cumpla el proyecto.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the Capac Qoya Communal Bank. It is located in the Coya-Pisac district, which is 50 minutes from the city of Cusco. She is 44, married, and has three children. They are 23, 12, and 7 years old. She alternates her activities between the home and teaching. She lives in the city of Cusco. Whenever she can take a little getaway, she always goes to the place she is from to see her relatives and such here in Coya. She works for the Ministry of Education. She is requesting a loan to start a small business. She plans to invest money in two possible businesses, which she will let us know about later. She believes that is she tells about it ahead of time, the project might not be completed. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Naida

texts.es:
La Sra. Naida tiene 25 años es soltera  y vive en la casa de sus padres en San Lorenzo, no tiene hijos.
La Sra. Naida se dedica a la venta de perfumes y ropas hace 5 años, sus ventas lo realiza en distintas ciudades, también es docente hace 4 años donde enseña en una escuela cerca de su casa..
Este crédito es para la compra de mayor cantidad a menor costo de las mercaderías que ella vende..
Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Naida, 25, is single and lives with her parents in San Lorenzo; she doesn't have any children. Naida has sold perfume and clothing for the last 5 years. She sells in various cities and, for the last 4 years, she has been a teacher in a school near her house. This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of the products she sells at lower cost. She is a person who has made a lot of progress in her life and is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Flor Del Pilar

texts.es: Flor tiene 24 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, con su madre y hermanos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando papa, maíz, quinua, arveja, cebolla y zanahoria, de acuerdo a la temporada climática de cada producto, es así que siempre esta en constante actividad, aplicando abono a sus terrenos de cultivo, que le fueron heredados. Sus hermanos la ayudan en esta labor y las veces que no pueden, contrata peones para que realicen el trabajo de siembra y cosecha. Es así, con el pasar del tiempo, cosecha maíz  y demás productos, exceptuando la papa, debido a que le son más rentables. Para Flor le es importante continuar cultivando en sus tierras y buscar otras estrategias de venta que le generen más ganancias. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y semillas para sembrar zanahoria.
texts.en:
Flor is 24 years old and lives in her parents’ house with her mother and siblings. Since childhood she has been engaged in farming – growing potatoes, corn, quinoa, peas, onions, and carrots based on the seasonal climate for each product. Determining these factors is a constant activity. Flor also is in charge of applying compost to the farmland that she inherited. Her siblings help with the labor, but during the times when they are not able, she hires workers to perform the tasks of planting and harvesting. With the passage of time, she began growing corn and other products that are the most profitable. Flor believes it is important to continue cultivating her land and looking for her sales strategies to generate more income.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is recommitted to being responsible with her payments since she considers the loans to be useful in helping progress her business. With the loan she requested, Flor will invest in the purchase of compost and seeds for planting carrots.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost and seeds for planting carrots

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. S., 49, and her husband, Keut Om, 48 run their business out of their home. They get cloth from the garment industry to sew into other products to sell, typically making US$3 a day to support their family’s daily expenses. They have five children, three of whom work in a garment factory. S. has difficulty delivering the finished clothing to her customers because her motor is too small to carry much. So S. is requesting a loan to buy a trailer to use with her existing motor so she can handle more clothes.

loans.use: To buy a trailer.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité   Mujeres unidas se  encuentra en su tercer  ciclo, tiene  un ahorro y todas se encuentran trabajando muy satisfechas.
 Una de las integrantes es la señora Mirian quien trabaja en la elaboración y venta de alimentos. Ella quiere comprar un puesto de venta por lo que solicita el préstamo.
Esto sería para dejar de pagar el alquiler en forma mensual y que resultaba muy caro.
Ella nos comenta que esta actividad le deja muy buena ganancia y mantiene muy bien a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee is in its third cycle; they have some savings and they are all working very happily. One of the group members is Mirian who prepares food for sale. She is asking for funds to buy a food sales stand so that she can save paying her current expensive monthly rental fees. She comments that this line of work produces good profits that support her family very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a food stand.

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Annamaria is 34 years old and married.  She is the adoptive mother of five nieces and nephews.  Annamaria sells birds (chickens, turkeys and ducks), water, soft drinks and cake.  She has been in business for five years.  She works from 7am until 9pm each day and earns about $215 per month.  With her loan, Annamaria plans to pay the school fees for one of her children who is entering Senior 5 year.  

This will be Annamaria's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Annamaria will share this loan with all 17 members of the Mpipi (Sweet) Group.  Group members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.  

Annamaria can be seen wearing a pink jacket in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhon Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people who live in Sampan Leu village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for different purposes that can improve their businesses. All the other members selected Mrs. Sokhon K. as the village bank president. She is 51 years old.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Sokhon K. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and rice seed, and with the rest of the loan she will rent a plow to plow her field. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory. Another sells for a  private company, and the youngest is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, rice seed, and to rent a plow

loans.name: Roena

texts.en: Roena M. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Roena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Roena operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling daily-use products, such as noodles, salt, sugar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Roena has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Roena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Roena from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie C. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Jessie owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. Jessie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes R. is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for her family.  A 55-year-old mother of one son, Arnold, she lives in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. Lourdes’ main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her family. 

In 2006, she was encouraged to join ASHI, the first KIVA partner in the Philippines. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her sari-sari (variety) store. Since then, her business has been performing well and earning her sufficient profit. 

Now, Lourdes needs working capital to help boost her business for increased profit making, so she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP for her variety store, to be used to pay for groceries to sell. 

Lourdes is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her family and being able to bring them into a decent way of life. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will in fact give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

loans.use: To pay for groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Leobegilda

texts.es:
Leobegilda es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo en una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de un considerable movimiento comercial, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de pan en un pequeño puesto ambulante situada en la parte exterior de una de las galerías comerciales mas frecuentadas de la ciudad en donde vive, ella vende su mercadería por las tardes, debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando y al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes, actualmente cuenta con una demanda estable y ella trata de mantenerla ofreciendo productos de calidad y un trato amable.

El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, y aunque su hijo ya trabaja, ella se vale de esta actividad para sentirse activa. Leobegilda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pan y dulces, de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Leobegilda es una mujer trabajadora, ella ha sacado adelante a su familia valiéndose de su negocio y ello la hace sentir orgullosa. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Leobegilda, 56, is a mother living with her son in a marginal urban area of Chepén district, an agricultural area with quite a bit of commercial activity, located in Chepén province, La Libertad region. It is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For over five years she has sold bread from a movable cart located outside one of the busiest shopping centers in the city where she lives. She sells her wares during the afternoons. Because of the length of time she’s been working and the good customer service she provides she has a stable base of regular customers which she does her best to keep satisfied with quality products and kind service. The business is an important source of family income. Although her son is already working, she avails herself of this activity in order to keep busy and feel useful. Leobegilda wants to expand her business buying more bread and candy so that she can continue to meet customer demand. This has led her to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her goal. Leobegilda is a hard working woman. She has raised her family thanks to her business and this makes her feel proud. She has collaborated with Our Institution in the past and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread and candy.

loans.name: Alison

texts.es: La Señora Alison se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas lo cual la señora es soltera y se dedica a vender con su Mamá en dicha Pensión. La señora llego a emprender recomendada por otra clienta que también accedió al crédito kiva, ella actualmente vive en la avenida blanco Galindo kilometro 4 1/2 de la ciudad de Cochabamba y esta muy feliz por estar con emprender y acceder al crédito kiva, el destino de su crédito es para poder comprar mas sillas y mesas para vender comida y bebidas. Ahora que lo invirtió el crédito tiene mas herramientas para poder trabajar y agrandar su negocio y crecer con kiva, es un apersona muy trabajadora que desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Alison sells food and drinks. She is single and sells food with her mother. She came to the microfinance organization at the recommendation of another client who has also had a loan from Kiva. She currently lives in Avenida Blanco Galindo in the city of Cochabamba and is very happy to get started and access credit through Kiva. This loan will be used to buy more tables and chairs for selling food and drink. With the credit available, she has more tools to be able to work and expand her business and grow with Kiva. She is a hardworking person and wants to improve the quality of life for all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs to grow her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta A. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 43 years old. Violeta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kam's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kam S. who was born in 1965 is the village bank president, having been selected by the 18 members, who are located in Preak Ta Kaov village, Kandal province.  Each member of this loan group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Mr. Kam S. is a hard worker who works in lotus farming and fishing to support the family. With the funding from the loan, he was able to purchase fishing nets and fishing supplies. This loan is useful to him because his catch can be sold at a good profit. His wife, Mrs. Hun Chi, who is 53 years old, stays at home and cooks for her family. This couple has three children and they all work at different jobs.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and fishing supplies

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen T. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Gretchen is single. To make a living, Gretchen owns and operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from services. Gretchen has done this for over 2 years; she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gretchen joined GDMPC in order to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Gretchen is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicles for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Gretchen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: repairing existing vehicles for better service

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Magsaysay Saguday Quirino. She is 50 years old. Helen is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making home frozen foods, banana chips, peanut butter and coated peanuts. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Helen is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, de 51 años, es una mujer optimista, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos; Nataly, de 20 y Ángel, de 30, con los que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Todos los días, desde las primeras horas, sale a pastar a los animales que comercializa; ya que es su principal actividad comercial. Ella posee, 3 toros, 5 vacas, varias cabezas de carnero, y 3 novillos pequeños que gracias a los cuidados que le brinda a diario podrán crecer fuertes y saludables. Cuando sus animales están aptos para ser comercializados, los ofrece en el camal de su localidad. Sin embargo Sabina cuenta, que en temporadas de invierno, cuando las vacas poseen más leche, ella aprovecha y elabora queso, el cual comercializa, juntamente a la leche sobrante. En adelante desea apoyar a su hija Nataly en la especialización de su oficio de cosmetóloga. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo, que integra su banco comunal, se siente satisfecha de apoyar en el surgimiento de sus socias. Con el crédito que obtendrá, lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera, que proporciona 10 litros de leche diarios; que le costará 3 mil nuevos soles.
texts.en: Sabina is 51 years old.  She is an optimistic woman and a single mother of 2 children; Nataly who is 20 and Ángel who is 30.  She lives with her children in her own home in the rural area of Huaricolca.  Every day from very early in the morning, she goes out to graze the animals which she sells as this is her main business activity.  She has 3 bulls, 5 cows, several head of rams and 3 young bulls which, thanks to the care which she provides them with every day, will grow up strong and healthy.  When her animals are ready to be sold, she offers them to her local slaughterhouse.  However, Sabina says that in winter seasons, when the cows have most milk, she takes advantage and makes cheese which she sells together with the left-over milk.  In the future, she would like to support her daughter Nataly in pursuing further studies in her chosen profession as a cosmetologist.  This is the fourth loan which she has had from MFP and during this time, in which she has been a member of her community bank, she feels happy to have helped support her fellow members.  With this loan she will invest in the purchase of a dairy cow which will provide her with 10 liters of milk a day and which will cost her 3,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Piedra del Toro del distrito de Morropón, ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, esta zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte). El brinda este servicio en la zona en donde vive y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Flavio es una persona bastante amable y con ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Flavio, 46, lives with his wife and children in Piedra del Toro, a town in Morropon, a district in the province of the same name, some three hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Flavio has operated a taxi business for four years, picking up and carrying passengers in a moto-taxi (a motorcyle with an attached cabin for passengers).  He operates the business in the town where he lives and the income from it has allowed him to support his family.

The moto-taxi has been in constant use and the wear and tear is beginning to show.  Flavio is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a S/.1,500 new soles loan so that he can fix the various problems that he has to urgently fix.

Flavio is a friendly person, eager to get ahead.  The people who know him say that he is responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: Repair and maintain moto-taxi.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 38 años, convive con Iván, de 40 años de edad. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que quieren y aman. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El deseo de Edith, es invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que según afirma, “la mejor herencia es darle la educación para que sean profesionales”. Por ello, hace 12 años que viene dedicándose a la venta de verduras, hortalizas y maíz, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma; los días de mayor movimiento son los miércoles, jueves y viernes. Donde mueve un capital de 3 mil a 2 mil nuevos soles diarios. Los cuales le generan un promedio de ganancia del 10%. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder vender todo lo invertido, pero como todo negocio, hay altibajos, y teme que puede perder sin recuperar la inversión. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y está contenta con el trabajo que desarrolla en su banco comunal, ya que son personas responsables y muy puntuales en los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de arveja y olluco, para venderlos en los días de feria.
texts.en:
Edith, 38, lives with Ivan, 40. They have 4 children that they love very much. The family owns the house where they live in, located in the town of Tarma. Edith's wish is to invest in her children's education, because as she says "the best inheritance is to provide them with an education so they can become professionals". That's why she has been selling vegetables and corn at the wholesale market in the town of Tarma for the last 12 years. The busiest days are Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, when the turnover is 2000 to 3000 soles a day and she obtains average profits of 10%. What she likes the most is when she is able to sell everything she's invested in, but as with any business there are ups and downs, and she is afraid to lose out without recovering the investment. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is happy with the work carried out in her loan group, because the members are responsible and very punctual in their payments. She plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of ullucos (root vegetables) and peas to sell on market days.

loans.use: Buy ullucos (root vegetables) and peas.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: Monsieur Dame D. est un menuisier ébéniste qui vit avec sa famille et ses parents à Mbour; il est âgé de 29 ans. Il est dans ce secteur d'activité depuis prés de 15 ans. Le but du prêt est l'acquisition de bois et autres matériaux pour prendre en devant certaines commandes de ses clients. Ainsi, il pourra bénéficier du gain de temps et de profit qui lui permettra d'anticiper sur ses dépenses quotidiennes et autres charges assimilées
texts.en: Mr. Dame D., aged 29, is a woodworker specializing in ebony.  He lives with his family and his parents in Mbour.  He has been working in this sector for almost fifteen years.  The goal of his loan is to acquire wood and other supplies and equipment to get ready for certain customer orders.  He would therefore be able to benefit from the time and the profit gained.  This will enable him to think ahead for his day-to-day expenses and other similar expenses.

loans.use: Equipment

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Marco; el tiene 49 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes el vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros productos más a la vez el socio es empleado jubilado de una empresa privada y de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marco is a member of the “LOS HERALDOS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marco is 49 years old, married and has 2 children.  His business is a grocery store where he sells essentials such as rice, sugar, milk and other products.  He is also retired from a job he had in a private company.  Through his business, Marco gets his family ahead in life.

Marco is requesting this loan to buy products for his business.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for his business

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 34 years old. She is a widow and has two children who are between two and six years old. Alphonsine has one dependent whom she cares and all her two children and one dependent are enrolled in school. Alphonsine sells vegetables and she has had this business for ten years. She says that her business was successful in that she gained a house from this business. With this new loan, she will buy more vegetables to sell. She said that with the new profits from her business she will establish a shop stocked with various items. In the future, she wishes to have a nice place compared to what she has currently.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gaviotas Sumi Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Flor H., un integrante del grupo Gaviotas Sumi, que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz, en México, se ve al grupo de señoras contentas en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne y embutidos que inició hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más producto para su negocio y de esta forma tenerlo bien surtido. Sus comparñeros y clientes la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta y satisfecha ya que por medio de este préstamo podrá incrementar sus ventas y clientes. Tiene 24 años, estudió la secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 1 hija. También espera en un futuro no muy lejano poder hacer algunos arreglos a su casa, ademas de ayudar a su familia y seguir apoyando a su hija con sus estudios y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Flor H.’s house.  She is a member of the “Gaviotas Sumi” (Sumi Seagulls) group.  The group is located in the state of Veracruz in Mexico.  You can see in the photo that the women in the group are happy.  

Flor sells meat and sausages, which she started doing one year ago.  She is requesting the loan to buy more products for her business.  That way her business will be well stocked.  Her colleagues and customers know her to be a responsible and hard-working person.  At the time of requesting the loan she feels very happy and satisfied because through the loan she will be able to increase her sales and customers.

She is 24 years old, and she has a high school education.  She is married and has one daughter.  She also wishes to be able to make some repairs to her house in the near future.  She wants to help her family and to continue supporting her daughter’s education.  This way she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy meat and sausages

loans.name: Djatougbé  Benoîte

texts.fr: Madame  Djatougbé   a 44 ans, mariée avec  3  enfants à  charge.  Elle habite quartier  Agoè  Logopé  où elle  fait  le commerce de produits d’alimentation.  Elle a débuté  en  1992 cette activité  et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle demande un crédit pour acheter  8 sacs du riz, 3 bidons d’huile, 2 cartons de tomate et 2 cartons  de boîte de  sardine.
texts.en: Ms. Djatougbé is 44 years old and married with 3 children in her care. She lives in the Agoè Logopé area, where she sells food products. She began this activity in 1992 and gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She is seeking a loan to buy 8 bags of rice, 3 cans of oil, 2 boxes of tomatoes, and 2 boxes of canned sardines.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Verónica Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señorita. Verónica A. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector  Loma de la Cruz en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad posee una belleza natural y arquitectónica, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una gran gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señorita. Verónica es soltera, tiene 26 años de edad y es madre de un un niño de 4 años de edad, vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, sus padres se dedican al comercio de ganado y con su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señorita. Verónica se dedica a la venta de joyas goldfiel, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, sus productos lo vende recorriendo por la ciudad, sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de más joyas para incrementar mas su negocio. Su meta es tener un almacén  de venta de joyas.
texts.en:
Srta. Verónica A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia”. She lives in the Loma De La Cruz sector of the city of Cuenca. This city possesses both natural and architectural beauty. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. The great food captivates the palates of both locals and foreigners.

Srta. Verónica is 26 years old, single, and the mother of a four year old son. She lives with her parents who share in the household expenses. Her parents are livestock traders who were able to build their own home as a result of their work.

Srta. Verónica has been selling the Goldfield line of jewelry for the past five years. She sells her products by traveling througout the city. Verónica works Sunday to Sunday, but without a set schedule.

She is receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank. Verónica will invest in the purchase of more jewelry so that she can increase her business even more. Her goal is to open a shop where she can sell jewelry.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mary Glenn

texts.en:
Mary Glenn A. is from the village of Layawan, Oroquieta City. She is 48 years old. Mary Glenn is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Mary Glenn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $238 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Glenn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase flour, sugar, vegetable oil and shortening. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, vegetable oil and shortening

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou S. (pictured above) is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Thout Srun, is 36 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have two sons. One is in school and another one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number Six outside Phnom Penh. 

Chanthou is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a driver. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital to her sister to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: to provide capital to her sister to purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol S. is from the village of Poblacion, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Carol is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Carol owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing (called "ukay-ukay") & detergents, snack foods & biscuits in the local community. Carol has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carol is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of used clothing. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Carol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay

loans.name: Unified Women Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento Mujeres Unidas es un grupo conformado por  D. 11 personas que conocen muy bien por que la mayoría del grupo se dedica a la venta calzados y  realiza sus ventas Cerca a las oficinas,  son muy unidas se ven todos los días; el único varón del grupo se dedica a la venta D. celulares. 	
La presidenta es la Sra. Daisy vive en casa propia por la av. Circunvalación vive junto a sus 2  hijas que ya son independientes, la mencionada señora es muy buena líder y se dedica a la compra y venta D. celulares como su principal actividad y también venD. juguetes, su tienda esta ubicado en una calle muy conocida D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba; con el dinero del credito comprara celulares y accesorios por cantidad,  es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Unified Women" is a group maD. up of 11 members who all know each other very well. The majority of the group sells shoes and they carry out their sales near business offices. They are very close and they see each other every day. The only man in the group sells cellular phones. 

The president of the group is Daisy. She lives in her own home located on Circunvalacion Avenue, and she lives together with her two grown daughters. She is a very good leader and she buys and sells cellular phones are her primary business. She also sells toys. Her store is located on a very well known street in the city of Cochabamba. With the funds from this loan she will purchase cellular phones and accessories in large quantities. She is a very hardworking woman and she is thankful to the organization for the support given her. All of the members are very responsible and hardworking individuals and they are thankful to the organization for the support provided to them.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phones and accessories in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvments in her home: to replace part of the roof and to tile the roof

loans.name: Ntepeko

texts.en:
Ntepeko is 41 years old, married and has three children. He has been a farmer for the past six years.
  
Ntepeko has been a good client for KADET LTD.  This is his third loan with KADET, which he will use to buy farm inputs. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

Ntepeko dreams of being prominent farmer. He is an diligent man who works with effort to attain more, despite limited resources.

loans.use: buy farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes tiene 33 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los cuatro hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, port mas de 12 años. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta cocinar lavar y planchar
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 33 years old, married and living with her husband and four children in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Narcisa de Jesús” and is located in San Temístocles which is part of Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

María is a farmer, especially of corn.  She’s been farming for over 12 years.  She does her purchases in Ventanas every month and her sales take place at the market there.

She is asking for the loan to buy seed, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations and illnesses in the crops and variations in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a farm.  She enjoys cooking, doing laundry and ironing.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married with five children and all her children go to school .She has no additional family members .Deborah sells charcoal. She has been in business for the last 10 years and sells to all categories at both retail and wholesale .Deborah has requested 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more charcoal and build her own stall. Deborah lives in a home that she doesn’t rent and her family has access to electricity and piped water .Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es:
Andrea del Carmen tiene 39 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Andrea se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es superar la crisis economica de la familia.

Le gusta cocinar para la familia.
texts.en:
Andrea del Carmen is 39 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchando por una Misma Causa'  community bank is located in La Primavera, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Andrea is a farmer who grows corn, rice and beans.  She buys her products in Comercial Peña and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Andrea is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  Her dream is to overcome her family's financial crisis.

Andrea enjoys cooking for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La Srta. María Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas” del Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 23 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Cuando su papá falleció, su mamá se quedó sola al cuidado de su hermana y de ella, como necesitaban dinero decidió apoyar a su mamá y con un capital de S/. 300.00 empezó a vender en un puesto del mercado de su comunidad, chorizo, cecina y derivados, de esa manera comenzó a ganar dinero y ayudar a la economía de su casa.  Ella tiene muchos deseos de superarse, estudió una carrera técnica, pero no pudo terminarla.
Actualmente continúa desarrollando esa actividad y sus ventas han crecido, tiene clientes fijos que siempre buscan sus productos por la calidad e higiene con que los prepara.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 comprará  carne y vísceras para elaborar sus productos de cecinas, chorizo y ahumados de esa manera poder surtir su negocio y atraer nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales. 

María Isabel es una mujer creativa y emprendedora,  su sueño es terminar sus estudios  y contar con un negocio que le permita continuar apoyando a su madre y a su hermana, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
María Isabel belongs to the communal bank “Las Lamañas”  from the Lamas district in Lamas province and the department of San Martín.  She is 23-years-old, single, and has no children.

When her father died her mother stayed single and cared for her sister and for her.  As they needed money, she decided to support her mother and with a working capital of 300 nuevos soles began to sell chorizo, cecina, and other meat products in a market stand in her community.  In this way she began to earn money and help her household economy.  She has many hopes of getting ahead and studied a technical career, though she couldn’t finish it.  

Currently she continues developing this work and her sales have grown.  She has regular customers who always look for her products because of their quality and the good hygiene practices she follows when she prepares them.

With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles she will buy meats and viscera to make her products (cecina, chorizo, and smoked meats) and be able to stock her business and attract new customers and keep old customers satisfied.

María Isabel is a creative and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to finish her studies and to have a business that will allow her to continue supporting her mother and sister.  She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering her the opportunity to start her business and continue growing it.

loans.use: to buy meat to make cecina (a cured pork product), chorizo (spicy sausage), and cueros (fried pork skin).

loans.name: Jony

texts.es: Jony de 20 años, soltero, vive en una casa alquilada, ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Jony, es un joven trabajador que no se conforma con lo que tiene. Desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a producir y labrar la tierra. Actualmente, Jony es estudiante sin embargo en sus horas de descanso se dedica a cultivar su parcela de cacao en compañía de sus padres y hermanos, quienes le ayudan en su labor. En el futuro, desea abrir una tienda de zapatos porque considera esta actividad podría serle más rentable que las labores del campo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que el se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Jony es un muchacho perseverante en su banco comunal.  Él espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes, para que pueda continuar con su trabajo. Con los 1.500 nuevos soles, lo  invertirá en el manejo agronómico de sus plantaciones de cacao, por tanto contratará peones.
texts.en:
Jony is 20 years old, single, and lives in a rented house in the district of Sivia. He is a young worker who is not satisfied with what he has. At a young age, Jony's parents taught him how to produce and work the land. Jony is currently a student, however he spends his leisure time cultivating his cocoa plot together with his parents and brothers, and helping his family with their work. 

In the future, Jony would like to open a shoe store as he believes this would be more profitable than farm work. As this is Jony's first loan with MFP, he is committed to the punctual repayment of his loan installments. Jony is a persevering young man in his village bank. He hopes for support from each of you, so that he can continue with his work. With the 1,500 nuevo soles Jony will invest in the agricultural management of his cocoa plantations, and will hence have the means to hire laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers for his cocoa plantation.

loans.name: Twaib

texts.en:
Twaib is a 34 year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests on him and his desire is to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

He has had a retail shop for four years and he got his initial capital from farming. His hardship is high commodity prices and his vision is to have a big retail shop and to educate his children.Twaib needs the loan in order to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Sadbargul

texts.ru: Садбаргул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем. Имеет 4 детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Садбаргул занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает ткани. В этой области она более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Sadbargul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 41 years old, married and has four children.  Her children attend a secondary school.  Sadbargul is involved in retail sales at a market.  She has a store, where she sells fabrics.  She has been in this business for over ten years.  Sadbargul is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single and lives with five family members, two of whom work.

H. has been an owner of a men’s clothing shop since 2006. He has good experience and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and his shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $1000 to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can add more inventories, which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo D. unos grupos D. señoras que se agruparon y decidieron formar el comité dentro del barrio. Este comité es D. la Ciudad D. San Lorenzo. El objetivo principal D. ellas es el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas, desean poder sobresalir no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
La Señora Nélida, presidenta del grupo tiene 32 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy optimista. Ella se dedica a la venta D. artículos varios. Comenta que gracias a esto ella ha podido brindarle a su familia los medios necesarios para brindarles una vida digna y decorosa. Además D. eso cuenta que tiene muchas ventas y pedidos D. sus clientes con lo cual le gustaría poder cumplir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina y bebidas para poder cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The United Women Communal Bank, or Mujeres Unidas Comité, was formed through the management and support of a few groups of women that got together and decided to form the committee within their neighborhood. This committee is of the City of San Lorenzo. The women’s principal objective is the growth of each member; they want to succeed not only economically, but also personally.

Ms. Nélida is the president of the group. She is 32 and is very enterprising, hardworking, and optimistic. She sells various articles. She says that thanks to that, she has been able to offer her family the means necessary to proviD. a dignified, respectable life. In addition, she says that she makes a lot of sales and has a lot of orders from her clients that she would like to fulfill. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, beans, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, and flour to be able to fulfill the requests of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, beans, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.es:
Crisanta cuenta 57 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando Dulce María está iniciando su primer año en medicina ya que logro quedarse en el politécnico de México y Eduardo está cursando el primer grado de bachiller su esposo se llama René él se dedica a la ganadería.

Ella y su esposo son comerciante vende pescado y  ganado venden vacas, chivos, marranos compran y crían para después vender o también matan los animales y vende la carne en el pueblo, ella dice que el préstamo le ayudo mucho económicamente ya que invirtió  en compra de marranos y chivos y ha estado sacando ganancias y así aportando para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. A doña crisanta le gustaría hacer más grande la granja.
texts.en:
Crisanta is 57 years old, married and has 2 children who are studying. Dulce Maria is beginning her first year in medicine at the polytechnic school in Mexico and Eduardo is in his first year of high school. Her husband is named Rene. He works in the field of livestock.

Crisanta and her husband have a business selling fish and livestock. They sell cows, goats, and pigs. They buy and raise them in order to later sell or they slaughter them to sell the meat in town. She says that the loan will be a big help financially as they have invested in the purchase of pigs and goats and have been using the profits to pay the educational expenses of their children. Crisanta would like to increase the size of the farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs and goats

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 58 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is divorced and has 2 children. 

Veronica has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month. She has requested a loan  of PHP 14,900  to purchase more clothes for her clothing business. 

Veronica has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Xopanapa Group

texts.es:
Grupo Xopanapa (palabra en Náhuatl que significa agua del aguacero)
Doña Mariana quien se dedica a las actividades del hogar atendiendo a sus hijos y su esposo. Ella asiste a las reuniones de la escuela de sus hijos, su lengua materna es el idioma Náhuatl. Doña Mariana acaba de iniciar con un negocio de venta de juguetes en su pueblo natal, ademas de juguetes vende material para artesanías. Pues así piensa ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos del hogar y los gastos de los útiles escolares de los hijos. 
La señora Mariana es la líder del grupo Xopanapa sus demás integrantes son:
Rufina-Panadería
Julia- Ropería
El grupo Xopanapa es muy agradecido con KIVA y FRAC por el crédito se les acaba de otorgar, el grupo está completamente seguro de que sus actividades serán triunfantes, para poder pagar el crédito y no atrasarse.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariana is a member of Grupo Xopanapa (a Náhuatl word meaning water from a rainshower). She takes care of the home and looks after her children and husband. She attends school meetings. She speaks Náhuatl. 

Mariana has just started a business selling toys and craft supplies in the local town so that she can help her husband pay for household expenses and school supplies for their children.

She is the leader of Grupo Xopanapa; the other members are Rufina who runs a bakery and Julia who sells clothing. The women are very grateful to Kiva and FRAC for the loan. They are sure that their businesses will do well so they can repay the money and not fall behind.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Kipetuan

texts.en:
Kipetuan has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last 24 years.  Besides farming, he also ventures in the quarrying business.  He is 51 years old, married to Maria and they have two school going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers and this will be his third loan.  He paid off his previous loans, and in good time. 

He plans to use this loan amount to increase the labor force in his quarry so he may increase his production and income.

In the future, Kipetuan hopes to buy a new lorry and own many quarries, sell the stones and expand his business to other parts of the country.

loans.use: to increase the labor force in his quarry.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 32-year-old widowed woman. She has three children who go to school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Faith has run a business selling maize for the past four years; her potential clients are residents of the local area. She has a major challenge which is transportation. She dreams of setting up a retail shop.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase 28 sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities.

loans.use: to purchase 28 sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 27 years old and a single man. He has been selling clothes and assorted items for the last year. His monthly income is about KES 14,000, and with a first loan of KES 30,000, he intends to purchase an additional stock of clothes for resale. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits by opening another business channel. His future hopes and dreams are to create employment to others.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Richar Alexander

texts.es:
Richar tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente con un hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa familiar con sus padres, la casa está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte céntrica de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos. Su padre dueño de la casa y de una parcela agrícola firma como aval en el presente crédito.

La actividad que desarrolla Richard es el transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, en la cual trabaja  diariamente.  Cuando llega la campaña de mango trabaja en una fábrica de procesamiento de la fruta de mango, en donde le pagan quincenalmente. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Richar desea repotenciar su mototaxi para poder trabajar óptimamente, ya que a la fecha por el uso se ha deteriorado y necesita algunas refacciones.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Richar is 29 years old. He lives with his partner and has a son in his care. He lives in the family home with his parents. The house is located in Tambogrande district. He lives in the central part of this district, and has basic services. His father owns the house and a parcel of farmland, and is co-signing this loan. 

Richar transports passengers in his mototaxi, and works at this daily. When the mango season comes, he works in a factory that processes mango fruit, where they pay every two weeks. 

With his earnings he covers his personal expenses, and those of his family.  Richar wishes to overhaul his mototaxi so that it can perform optimally, since it has deteriorated through use and needs some repairs. This is why he has decided to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevos soles at Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To overhaul his mototaxi.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is 29 years old, married, and blessed with a three-year-old child.  To earn a living, he recycles metals to make window and door frames.  He has been in this business for four years and has employed two people.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management skills.  This has helped him in budgeting and good record-keeping.

Luke hopes to expand his business premises in the future.  He needs a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy scrap metals and metal rods.

loans.use: to buy scrap metals and metal rods.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Brasilia, en la provincia de Alajuela. Por esa área se da mucho el turismo por motivo del Volcán Arenal ubicado en sus cercanías, con el bosque nubloso de Monteverde y las tierras bajas del norte del país. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.
 
Desde hace varios meses  Yesenia se dedica a su negocio. Ella brinda sus servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.

Actualmente Yesenia está solicitando un microcrédito de 400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para la compra de los ingredientes o materia prima para su panadería, ya que quiere darles a sus clientes el mejor calidad de producto, necesita solventar y tener otro ingreso económico para su hogar. 

Ella es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Brasilia S.A, razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 28 years old and lives with her family in Brasilia, a community in the province of Alajuela. In this area, a lot of tourists come to see Arenal Volcano which is located nearby, and also to see the Monteverde cloud forest and the lowlands in the northern area of the country. In Alajuela there are five national parks, a national wildlife reserve, five protected zones, and many forest reserves. The Juan Santamaría Museum is also in this province, and has exhibits of locally made handicrafts. This zone is the nation's number one producer of coffee and sugar cane.

Yesenia has been working at her business for several months. She provides service to the neighbors of her community, and they are very satisfied by the quality of her products.

She is asking for a loan of 400,000 colones to buy ingredients and supplies for her bakery, as she wishes to give her customers the best quality products. In order to do that, she needs a loan and she wants to have additional income for her home.

She is a member of the Brasilia Community Credit Union, and is very thankful for the opportunities provided her by accessing a loan. It will allow her to realize the goals in her life.

loans.use: buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Tak, 33, is a humble rice farmer who resides in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has a common law relationship with her husband who is also a farmer. They have been blessed with three children who are still students in the local public school in the province. Besides working in the field, Tak has been raising pigs at home to increase her household income.

Now Tak would like to acquire a 5,000,000 KHR loan from HKL to pay for local farm laborers to plow her field and to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. Her goal is to expand her farmland and increase its yield so as to better her life.

loans.use: to pay for laborers to plow her field and to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rwot Amio Group

texts.en:
Anna is a divorced mother with 4 school going children. She resides in Apii village Lira Municipality having divorced her husband who took to over drinking and became irresponsible and stopped taking care of the family.
