She sales second hand clothes in outside markets a business which supports her family and pays school fees for her children.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 through the group to boost her business.
She is grateful to Kiva funders and Ugafode MIcrofinance for the support accorded.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa owns a small business where she sells clothing for men and women. Before setting up a spot in her home as a point of sale, Rosa would travel around her neighborhood selling clothing and other items. Eventually, her age and the years of work caught up to her and she had to quit because of a disease in her liver. As soon as she got better she decided it would be healthier for her to set up a business in her home. She has been successful because of the client base she built throughout her years as a street vendor. She needs the loan to purchase merchandise at whole quantities and prices.

Rosa has 6 children who are already grown up. Her husband works at one of their sons furniture making business as an assistant. Rosa is proud that all her children are hard workers and have their own microenterprises. She is also happy to have the ability to contribute to her family income by way of this business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at whole quantities and prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will invest the loan in the purchase of tools and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en:
Mammad is a 33 year-old, married man and father of one child who lives with his family in the town of Lokbatan. While unemployed, he began to think through potential business start-up ideas.

During this time, he decided to start his first private business. In 2006, he received a $500 loan from the Normicro Baku branch and invested it into his tailoring business. His business is now up and running, but many improvements can still be made to it in order to ensure its sustainability. Now, he is requesting $1,000 so that he can purchase additional raw materials to provide better tailoring services to his growing customers.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Frideen

texts.en: Frideen lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is single and lives with his family.  He started his own business selling DVDs and cassettes.  He wants to improve his business so that he can make a good income and be successful in the future.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes owns the Agnes Beauty Salon in the village of Makindye on the outskirts of Kampala.  She is married with 5 children and she cares for 2 orphans.  She has owned her business for 10 years and has been a part of her lending group for 2 years.  

Her salon is in a stand-alone shanty-shack located on dirt road.  The floor dirt is covered with a rolled out piece of colorful vinyl.  She has decorated the salon with posters.  There is no electricity so she does not have a hair dryer.

With her loan she plans to buy braids, weaves and chemicals.  Agnes dreams of one day buying a plot of land and building her own home.

loans.use: Agnes plans to use the loan to buy braids,weaves and chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.en: Lutfy J. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. She works in the Joint-Stock Company “Navbakhor” in the commercial industry of the national-styled and european-styled wear. She is an active client of MicroInvest and the statistics indicate  an income increase and business stability. Now Lutfy requires a loan  of $175 for a special furniture purchase because she is a very skilled seamstress. Working in wear making she requires special furniture that makes the produced goods more qualitative and engaging.

loans.use: Special furniture purchase

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino S. is a twenty seven year old mother from the village of Sologa Mulifanua. She has two children and both of them are attending the village primary school. Fuatino’s husband works as a Tile Layer at  Mormon Construction and he gets paid every week. Fuatino is running a plantation which she works on with her husband when he is available. She sells her products at the Fugalei Flea Market three days a week and her income for the week is usually $500. She is one of our oldest members and she is young and active.

loans.use: “Buy fualama {small new plants} and equipment for her Business.”

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah, 34, is married to S. who no longer works. To support the family, she sells flavoured ice and fried snacks at her food stall infront of her house, earning $8 a day with a very small profit. To expand her business she is requesting a loan of $100 and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
In the city of Esteli, specifically in the town of Condega, Mrs. Martha Elena G., for the past four years, has dedicated herself very enthusiastically to her general store, a business she has established in her own home in this town. Among the products she offers are groceries, beverages, cosmetics, soaps, brooms, etc.

Today, she is in great need of larger quantities of products for her business. For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will permit her to improve her economic situation and thus supplement her business to provide her children with a better lifestyle so that they can enjoy better household conditions. Her actual credit record is 4 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de Esteli, específicamente en el municipio de Condega la señora Martha Elena G. muy esforzadamente desde hace 4 años se dedica la negocio de la pulpería teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación en este municipio. Entre los productos que ella ofrece se encuentran comestibles, bebidas, cosméticos, jabones, escobas, etc.

Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de mayores cantidades de productos para su negocio. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica y de esta manera suplir su negocio para brindar a sus hijos y un mejor estilo de vida donde puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones en el hogar. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Akpene

texts.en: Ms. Akpene A. is 30 years old and the married mother of one child.  Akpene owns a salon in Adéta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She specializes in ‘tresses,’ a popular African hairstyle of braids made with synthetic hair.  Akpene hopes to use this loan to buy another large mirror for the interior of her salon and also to invest in more hair products.  With the revenue generated from her business, she will be able to improve the quality of life for her family and contine to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy another mirror and hair products

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy, is a 25 year old responsible model father; 3 years ago he completed his advanced degree as an educator but due to a lack of job opportunities he has not been able to employ his profession.

Currently, to earn a living and to satisfy his family’s most urgent needs, he provides urban transportation services to the town of Juliaqueña by way of his motorcycle taxi that he was able to purchase from his own savings.

While Fredy is dedicated to his labor, his beloved spouse Nelly and young daughter sell commercial products. Due to their efforts and perseverance they have been able to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Fredy, es un responsable y ejemplar padre de 25 años de edad, hace 3 años concluyó sus estudios superiores como profesor y por falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede ejercer su profesión.

Actualmente para ganarse el sustento de su familia y cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes se dedica a brindar servicios de movilidad urbana a la población Juliaqueña en su moto taxi que adquirió con los ahorros que poseía.

Mientras Fredy se dedica a esta esforzada labor su querida esposa Nelly acompañada de su pequeña niña se dedica al comercio de artículos por campañas, gracias al esfuerzo y empeño de ambos es que están logrando mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Request for an increase in capital to help fund his wife's business

loans.name: Mewinasso Group

texts.fr:
The MWEINASSO Association was created in July of 2007. It brings together seven energetic women who lead various income-generating activities. The president opened a shop selling basic goods, others do business in grains, cell phone credit cards, and vegetables. This group is well-supervised by the president who understands management. MWINASSO group’s members' first objective is to make profit through business, and secondly, mutual aid. Usually they buy their merchandise at the main market before taking it to local markets for retail. The first loan that they are seeking will allow them to buy some cartons of soap, two cartons of milk, some cell phone credit cards, toothpaste, and grains. This loan will support their business activities and they will also be able to participate in their respective family’s spending with the profits they will earn.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

L’Association MEWINASSO est crée en juillet 2007. Elle regroupe sept (7) femmes dynamiques qui mènent des activités génératrices de revenus variées. La présidente a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits de premières nécessités, les autres c’est le commerce de céréales, de cartes de recharge et des légumes. Ce groupe est bien encadré par la présidente qui a les notions de gestion. Les membres du groupement MEWINASSO ont pour objectif premier la recherche du profit à travers l’exercice d’une activité et en second l’entraide mutuelle. Généralement elles achètent leurs marchandises au grand marché avant de procéder à la vente dans les marchés locaux. Le premier crédit qu’elles sollicitent leur permettra d’acheter des cartons de savons, 2 cartons de lait, des cartes de recharges, des pâtes dentifrices et des céréales. Ce prêt viendra en appui a leur activité et elles pourront aussi participer aux dépenses de leurs familles respectives par le bénéfices qu’elles auront à dégager.

loans.use: Retail of basic goods and grains

loans.name: Rithe

texts.en: Mr. Rithe D. is a villager in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a subsistence farmer and construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Sundany Khon, is employed in a garment factory. They now live with their parents and they would like to build a new house where they can live on their own. So Mr. Rithe D. decided to ask for a loan to be able to afford a new house. So far, Mr. Rithe D. obtained a loan to pay for his wedding ceremony. Mr. Rithe D. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Mrs. Lois P., 35, sells a range of vegetables to the people in her community. In the early morning she buys vegetables from a broker and she begins reselling them from 7am until 2pm. Her daily income of $1.80 US is barely enough to cover her household’s expenses and her children's education.

To ease the financial constraint in the family, her husband is working as a construction foreman making around $4 each day. One of her children also works in construction, while her other four are students. Watching her husband do laborious construction work from day to day, Mrs. Lois P. would like to purchase more construction tools for him to do his job both faster and easier.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools for her husband to facilitate his work.

loans.name: J Socorro

texts.es:
El Sr. Socorro tiene ya algunos años construyendo su casa ya casi la tiene terminada nada más le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la vivienda y el piso de concreto en el patio.
El Sr.  es empleado de una compañías aquí en Nuevo Laredo su puesto es de mensajero (Su trabajo es entregar documentación a otras compañía aquí en la ciudad);este es su ingreso familiar. Tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando.

El Sr. Socorro P. a tenido ya 2 créditos de construcción con FVP los cuales los pago puntualmente es un cliente muy responsable en sus pagos.

Le está solicitando un tercer crédito por medio de  Kiva para comprar el material y tener su casa terminada completamente. El esta solicita un préstamo de $975.00.dlls.
texts.en:
Señor Socorro has been building his house for a few years now, and he almost has it finished. He only needs to finish the outside and the concrete floor of the patio.

Señor Socorro works at a company here in Nuevo Laredo as a messenger (he delivers documentation to other companies here in the city). His family's income comes from his job. He has two children, who are in school.

Señor Socorro P. has already had two credits with FVP, which he paid back on time. He is a very responsible client with his payments.

He is requesting a third credit from Kiva to purchase construction material and to finish his house completely. The loan amount is $975.


Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the outside of his house and the floor of his patio

loans.name: Asoiva

texts.en: Asoiva F., 30, is married with four children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation of taro taamu and  banana business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Asoiva's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy farming equipments, chemicals, pesticides and seedlings, while the rest of the money will be used to buy timber, iron roofs and cement for home improvement.

loans.use: Asoiva would like to purchase farming equipment, chemicals, pesticides and seedlings and home improvement.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 26 year old man. He lives with his parents in Saida, southern Lebanon. He is a car polisher. He has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his business such as polish, oil, paints, and glass papers. This is his second cycle and he always pays on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for his business.

loans.name: Saophea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saophea P., the 44-year-old mother of three children, all attending the local school, is the group leader of four people living in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living.  Because they do not have oxen to plow the field, Saophea is requesting a loan for that purpose. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow the field.

loans.name: Fileratou

texts.fr:
Madame K. est une femme âgée de 49 ans qui achète les pagnes et tissus Bazin au grand marché de Lomé et les revend à Agoè, un quartier au nord de la ville.  Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle aide son mari qui est retraité pour soutenir leur enfant et payer les dépenses du domicile.  
Madame K. a commence ce commerce depuis 2001, et elle a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES.  Elle a bien remboursé ce premier crédit de 150,000 CFA ($300), donc actuellement elle a augmenté le montant qu’elle sollicite.  Avec ce second crédit, elle peut acheter les pagnes et tissus basin afin de mieux vendre et gagner un profit.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a 49 year old woman who buys traditional wrap-arounds and damask cloth in the main market of Lomé and resells them in Agoè, a neighbourhood to the North of the city. With the income she makes, she helps her husband who is retired to support their child and pay the household expenses. Mrs. K. has been in this business since 2001 and she has borrowed once previously from WAGES. She has since repaid her first loan of 150,000 CFA ($300), and therefore she has asked to borrow a larger amount. With this second loan, she will be able to buy wrap-arounds and damask cloth in order to have more sales and make a profit.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional wrap-arounds and damask cloth

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Clementina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos mayores en su propia casa. Tiene su propia tienda desD. hace 2 años, notó que era la mejor oportunidad D. generarse ingresos económicos y aunque son modestos está perseverante en este negocio, donD. atienD. todos los días y durante casi todo el día. Su mayor venta está en las gaseosas y cervezas que venD., Clementota está buscando en la actualidad aquellos productos D. mayor consumo y productos novedosos para seguir vendiendo. Es la primera vez que Clementina tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte D. su banco comunal porque conocen que es una persona responsable y cumplidora D. lo que promete. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más mercadería para su tienda, 200 soles será para la compra D. verduras y condimentos y lo que resta para la compra D. bebidas.
texts.en:
Clementina is 53 years old, and lives with her husband and three children in their own home. She has had a shop for the past two years, as it was the best way to generate income and although that income is modest she has continued with the business. Clementina works nearly all day long every day. Her best sellers are soft drinks and beer. Clementina is presently looking into products that would sell well and new products to market. This is the first time that Clementina has taken out a loan with MFP. She was invited to join the banco comunal, a business support group, because she is known to be a responsible person who finishes what she starts. With the money requested, Clementina will buy more merchandise for her store. 200 soles will go towards the purchase of vegetables and condiments, and the remainder for beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Savy Yen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people living in Andoung Pour village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Savy Y., the 39-year-old village bank president, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Em Chan, is a construction worker. Mrs. Savy Y. has five children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase goods to expand grocery business

loans.name: Sherley

texts.en:
Sherley S. is a resident of Calamagui 1st village, Isabela, Philippines. She is 49 years old and married to Andy, who is 56 years old and a vendor. The couple was blessed with six children. Michael is a commerce graduate, now working abroad as an OFW.  Reymund is a graduate of a secretarial course. Jason, Dennis, and Jenivie are currently in college. Paul is in third grade. According to Sherley, hers is a close and supportive family. 

She and her husband sell toys for kids in a small store in their village. This has been their family's main source of income since the 1990s. Sherley and her husband were able to send all of their children to school. She is thankful that they are able to support their family. Now Sherley wants to improve their business and needs a loan to provide additional business capital.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Carolina Elizabeth

texts.es: Carolina Elizabeth P. R., reside en Ilopango junto a su compañero de vida y su  pequeña hija. A sus 26 años de edad y a pesar de ser una mujer muy joven, es una mujer que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y honrada. Carolina posee una sastrería en la cual se encarga de coser ropa para hombre, a pesar que el negocio esta ubicado muy lejos de su casa, aproximadamente hora y media, logra obtener muy buenas ganancias. A pesar de esto Carolina necesita mejorar su negocio, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda comprar más tela para sus trajes, y de esta manera brindarles más productos a sus clientes y poder entregarles sus pedidos más rápido. Ella desea mucho poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de esta manera mejorar su estilo de vida pero en especial  el de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Carolina Elizabeth P. R. lives in Ilopango with her live-in partner and young daughter. She is 26-years old, and although very young, stands out as an honest and hard worker. Carolina owns a tailor's shop that makes men's clothing. Even though the business is far from her house, about one and a half hours, she earns a good profit. Still, Carolina needs to improve her business. Therefore she is requesting a loan, through which she can buy more fabric for the suits she makes, thereby offering more choices to her customers and finishing orders more quickly. She hopes to help her husband with household expenses and thus improve their quality of life, especially for her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of sacks of cereals, yams, and baskets of cheese for re-sale

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Jackeline Blas  Z. tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el  barrio Los Martines, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos los cuales dos estudian y el bebe de 20 meses, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que no logrado terminar de construir su casa. Ella desde hace 3 años, es operaria de Zona Franca, la mayor dificultad que se le presento es la fallecimiento de sus mamá y el accidente de su esposo; ya que con mucho esfuerzo, cumplió con sus cuotas de pagos. El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder seguir construyendo su casa para lograr una casa digna para su familia, este es su sexto ciclo de préstamos en Afodenic y da las gracias por los objetivos adquiridos y desarrollo para  su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jackeline Blas Z. is 27 years old and lives in the Los Martines neighborhood, together with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses. They have 3 dependent children; two remain in school and they also have a 20 month old baby at home. Their plan for their family is to improve the conditions in which they live; they have yet to reach their goal of completing the construction of the family home. For three years, Jackeline has been working in a factory in the Free Trade Zone known as Zona Franca and dedicated primarily to textile production. The greatest difficuty she has faced has been the death of her mother and an accident that affected her husband. With a lot of effort she has complied with her loan payment plan. She wants this loan for the purchase of construction materials, so that she and her husband can continue the work on their home in order to achieve their dream of providing a dignified home to their family. This is Jackeline's sixth loan cycle with Afodenic and she is thankful for the objectives she has met and the improvements in her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials in order to finish building her family's home

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica J., married to a driver and the mother of four children, has been selling flour, rice and oil since 1988 in Yamoransa in Cape Coast. Veronica has received education to junior high school, and she is responsible for paying the children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase flour, rice, sugar, groundnuts and beans for resale. Veronica hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house and provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, sugar, groundnuts and beans for resale.

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Santana es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Santana es conviviente, tiene  59 años, cuatro hijos todos mayores.
Santana empezó vendiendo panes, con los ahorros compro un moto-car en cuotas, lo puso a trabajar y al tiempo compró uno mas y después uno mas,  actualmente con sus ahorros  ha comprado una couster, su esposo maneja y su hijo cobra.  
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser  una empresaria, aprendió a invertir, sacar sus cuentas, y ha trabajar para que su negocio crezca.  
Santana necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para invertir en su carro, va planchar su carro para que pase la revisión técnica.
El sueño de Santana es darle a cada uno de sus hijos un carro para, para que lo trabajen.
texts.en:
Santana is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She is married; is 59; and has 4 children, who are all adults. Santana started her business by selling bread. With her savings, she purchased a motorcycle richshaw. She put it to work, and with time she purchased another one and then one more. Now with her savings, she has purchased a mini-bus which her husband drives, and her son sells tickets for. Since she has worked with Finca, she has learned to be a businesswoman and how to invest and to keep her books. She has worked so her business would grow. Santana needs a loan of 2,600 PEN to invest in her car so it will pass inspection. Her dream is to give each one of her children a car so they can work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Santana needs a loan of 2,600 PEN to invest in her car so it will pass inspection

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia L. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Verginia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Verginia owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Verginia is just starting this business.

In 2006, Verginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verginia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Verginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Bandinas II”, Distrito D. la Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 44 años y madre D. 01 hijo, que aun esta bajo su cargo.Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta D. abarrotes, ya son años que se dedica a este tipo D. venta.Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco y con un crédito D. S/. 300.00 comenzó a comprar sus productos, para establecer su bodeguita.Hoy sus vecinos, amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir D. boca y esa es una D. sus ventajas grandes que tiene, para generar sus propios ingresos y D. esta manera ser responsable con sus cuotas.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes D. leches y aceites; también paquetes D. gaseosas D. diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así D. esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Benita is a client of the Community Bank “Las Bandinas II”, in the District of Banda D. Shilcayo, San Martín Province, San Martín. She is 44 years old, and lives with her one child and his father. Benita tells us she began her business selling groceries, and has devoted herself to this business for years. She established her business, saving little by little, and with a loan of S/. 300.00 began to purchase the products to establish her little shop. Today Benita's neighbors and friends know her and are well received, and her sales are going well. This is a great advantage, as generating her own income allows Benita to be responsible with her payments. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, Benita will purchase groceries such as: rice and sugar in bags, packages of milk and cooking oil, packages of soft drinks in different flavors and sizes, cleaning products for the home and personal hygiene products. This way she will keep her customers satisfied and happy. Benita feels very satisfied with the work she undertakes, and believes it is worth the sacrifice to achieve the dreams and goals she has established in her life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing support to her and other women who want to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to augment her inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Upendo North borrower group in Kinyanambo. She is 22 years old, single, and has a one-year-old child.

Grace started her own business selling clothes one year ago. She works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 70,000 Tanzanian shillings (about $53 US).

This is Grace’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 shillings in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Grace hopes to expand her business and save more money.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married with three children. She has got a small cafe located at the central market in Vinogradovo city. She used to sell small home products at the same market. Because of high competition she decided to change her business and began to make food and sell it to the market vendors. This happened about two years ago. Natalia's income increased and became more stable.

Natalia would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase additional equipment for her cafe. This would allow her to increase the assortment and produce more food for sale.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Monicah Cherotich

texts.en:
Monicah is 41 years old and she is blessed with one a four year old child .Her retail shop is located in Eldoret Town (in the rift valley) and her major clients are residents of Kahoya.

She has been in this retail business for the past nine years.With the loan she is taking from KADET she intends to buy more stock which includes sugar,water,cocoa,rice,biscuits,soaps ,detergents and cooking oil.In future she wants to grow her business to wholesale,build a house and educate her child.

She was introduced to KADET by a client.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop which include sugar,rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old. She is married to Adriano. They were gifted with five children and all of them are high school graduates.

Virginia is aiming to develop her direct sales business. To do this, she is now borrowing a business capital of PHP 5,000. This amount will help her to purchase more products to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that through her hard work, she can succeed in her business someday.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Samphors Maen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which located in Bang Bat village in Takeo province is made up by nineteen people and they will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Samphors M. owns a small grocery store to sell in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for loan to buy more grocery goods for selling. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Chamnan, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Samphors M. is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. 

Ten members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for loan to buy more grocery goods for selling.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose G. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through the basic education level. Rose sells fish and “white clay” in Kwamikrom, which she has done since 1999. The “white clay” is a particular clay type in a part of the Volta Region in the Republic of Ghana, which is burnt in a very hot oven and eaten as something of one's choice. 

Rose uses her income to pay for payment of the children’s school fees and other housekeeping expenses. Rose will use the loan to buy more of the clay for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more clay for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 25-year-old businessman. He repairs electronics like radios and watches in Huruma estate in Nairobi. He also earns extra income through the sale of scrap metal. He says that his business is located along a busy road and this is a good location for business. He is requesting his first loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to boost his business. He hopes to own a stable electronics business and improve the living standards of his family. He describes himself as ambitious, hardworking and determined.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking microfinance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To boost an electronics business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre de dos  hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de menús, su puesto está ubicado en un mercado en la ciudad de Pucallpa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es chofer de camión (transportista). Forma parte del Banco Comunal “De la Amistad II” desde hace dos años y cuatro meses.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en frutas regionales. Actualmente requiere un crédito de 1000 soles, que utilizará para comprar arroz, azúcar, carnes al por mayor. La meta de Margarita es tener un local propio para su restaurante, ya que el que tiene es alquilado.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is one our dynamic and collaborative members who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a teenager. Margarita sells prepared foods from her vending location at a market in Pucallpa. She has the support of her husband, who works as a truck driver. Two years and four months ago, she joined the Communal Bank “De la Amistad II”. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to buy regional fruits. Margarita is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar, and meat in bulk. Her goal is to open her own restaurant since her current location is in a rented space.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and meat

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday E. is 50 years old and is married to a doctor. She has one child who does not go to school. Sunday is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Sunday hopes to be able to open up a retail shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Roen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of seventeen people who live in Kouk Trab Village in Kandal Province. 

Mrs. Mach R. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice. In addition to her farm, she also sells things. Although she tries to work hard, she still earns less income to than she needs to support her family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Mach R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a sewing machine to earn more money. She is 37 years old and single with a child who attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Salvation Group

texts.en:
Aba is 38, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her family at Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. She has been a baker for six years who uses flour for her production. In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes bread, cake, meat pie, chips, etc. and sells at retail to her customers. She sells by herself in the market center, and people also take bulk delivery bread from her.

Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests a loan support to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

Aba is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Salvation’. She is the one sitting second from left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small traders and food sellers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 6 años se dedica la venta D. granos y queso D. manera ambulante. Los días cuando mayores ganancias obtiene es cuando hay ferias en su zona. Por ello, se abastece  cada 15 días, para que su negocio siga siempre activo. Yolanda está muy contenta con este negocio porque le permite solventar los gastos D. su familia. 
Para más adelante, desD. tener un puesto estable donD. pueda vender mayor cantidad D. quesos y otros productos comestibles, logrando crecer hasta ser una distribuidora alimentos al por mayor.

Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta D. pertenecer a un banco comunal, ya que con el apoyo D. sus compañeros ha superado varias dificultades económicas.
En esta ocasión, el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería en granos, como menestras y cereales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children in the family's own house. For the past 6 years, Yolanda has been selling bulk dry foods and cheese as a mobile vendor. She obtains her highest profits on days when there are markets in her area. Because of this, she stocks up on supplies every 15 days, so that her business will always be active. Yolanda is very happy with this business, because it lets her ensure that her family's expenses are covered. For the future, she wants to have a permanent sales stand where she can sell a larger quantity of cheeses and other food products, and eventually expand her business into a wholesale food distributor. This is Yolanda's seventh loan with MFP, and she is very happy to belong to a communal bank, since with the support of her fellow members, she has been able to overcome a number of economic difficulties. On this occasion, the funds she is requesting will be invested in purchasing bulk dry foods such as beans and grains.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her inventory

loans.name: Mrs.seng Kim Thai Villag Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Mrs. Seng Kim T. is a village president who has been selected by the group members. They all use the loan for different purposes. 

She is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Bou Oring, is a Khmer noodle seller in the local market. This family earns a small income even though  they try to work hard in their business. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Seng Kim T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more noodles and vegetables for resale to increase profits. 

She is the mother of six children. One is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction laborer and another one helps with housework.  Her other children all attend a local public school. 

All the group members are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more noodles and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca  rodeo grande la señora Ada luz E., se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también realiza actividades agrícolas como el establecimiento de cultivos anuales como maíz, ajonjolí, frijoles y sorgo, todos destinados a mejorar las condiciones económicas del hogar ya que ella tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo, doña Ada luz ha tenido tres créditos con CEPRODEl los que han mejorado su sistema productivo a través del aumento del hato ganadero que maneja y mejorando la forma en que establecía los cultivos.
texts.en:
Ada Luz E. lives in Somotillo, Rodeo Grande. She raises farm animals like: sheep, pigs and fowl. She also farms certain annual crops like: corn, sesame, beans and sorhgum. All this is aimed at improving her family's economic situation because she has two children that depend on her and her husband. Ada Luz has had three loans with CEPRODEL which have helped her to improve her productive system by increasing the number of animals in her herd and improving the way she manages her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four, lately delivered, cows.

loans.name: Sartañani Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sartañani” esta representado por la señora Gloria Delfina y conformada por 10 D. los cuales 8 son mujeres y dos varones.  La señora Gloria Delfina es madre D. familia su esposo se fue  a trabajar  al extranjero y D. ves en cuando manda algunas provisiones para sus hijos, ella es madre D. dos niños en edad escolar por lo que la señora Gloria tiene que trabajar todo el día en su puesto D. venta D. pantuflas, sandalias y zapatos D. goma para poder obtener un ingreso para los libros y el material escolar D. sus hijos ya que el dinero que envía su esposo solo le alcanza para el pago D. alquiler D. la casa donD. viven y para un pequeño ahorro que esta destinado a la compra D. un terreno para brindarles mayor comodidad y un futuro mejor a sus hijos, el crédito esta destinado a la adquisición D. mercadería al por mayor D. las distribuidoras. El resto D. las socias se dedica a la comercialización D. artesanías, costura, productos D. limpieza y venta D. comida. En el mercado existe bastante competencia sin embargo ellas se valen D. la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir sus mercaderías y siempre están D. acorD. a la época y a las exigencias D. su mercado. El destino del crédito es principalmente el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo y la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y materiales para agrandar sus puestos y mejorar suus ingresos como lo hicieron en el primer ciclo que cursaron juntas demostrando siempre puntualidad, responsabilidad y muchas ganas D. salir adelante para mejorar y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Sartañani” group is represented by Mrs. Gloria Delfina and is maD. up of 10 members, of which 8 are women and 2 are men. Mrs. Gloria Delfina is the mother of a family. Her husband went abroad to work and from time to time sends supplies for their children. She is the mother of two school-aged children and thus she has to work all day in the stand selling slippers, sandals, and rubber shoes to get some income for their books and school supplies. The money that her husband sends is only enough to pay the rent of their house and for small savings to be used to buy a piece of land. This will give them a more comfortable living situation and a better future for their children. The loan is for the purchase of merchandise from wholesale distributors. The rest of the members work in selling handicrafts, tailoring, cleaning supplies and selling food. There is a lot of competition in the market but they are valued for the speed they have to change and proviD. merchandise appropriate to the season and the demands of the market. The loan is mostly for increasing their working capital and to acquire merchandise, ingredients and materials to enlarge their stands and improve their earnings as they did in their first loan cycle. Then they always demonstrated punctuality, responsibility and the desire to get ahead and continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: The Blessing Of God Family Group

texts.en:
Mardea B. is the leader of a five-borrower group called The Blessing Of God Family. She is 38 years old, single, and has two children, aged 16 and 6 years old. She was not able to graduate from high school due to lack of financial support.

For more than 9 years, Mardea has been selling charcoal at the Gaye Town market on Old Road in Monrovia, Liberia. She started by helping a lady who was in charcoal sales.

Mardea sells her goods at a stable price, which keeps her customers returning. Sometimes, however, she has problems with the poor quality of the bulk charcoal she buys. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 39,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more charcoal in bulk to resell.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mardea is the one holding the sign. Musu Kiazolu is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
N. Sarah’s odds to succeed in her four-year-old water-selling business are in the ascendant, mostly boiling down to her entrepreneurial resourcefulness. She started off from scratch with no piped water within her vicinity in Kireka, Kampala.

Notwithstanding this, 42-year-old Sarah has persisted in making enormous headway in her business. She bought a small water tank. This flood-tide has gotten her to a point where she makes profits to the tune of 100,000 shillings monthly.

Sarah’s good line of business conduct has significantly played into her hands as she now has a niche in her home area. She wants to buy a second water tank with the assistance of this loan.

loans.use: To buy a second water tank

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Victoria es separada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, ropa y frutas, de las ferias compra animales menores que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos.
Los sueños de Victoria son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank Llamkasum, which means "we clothe" in Quechua. Victoria is separated. She is 32 years old and has 4 children. Victoria travels to different fairs in the region where she sells general groceries, clothing and fruit. At the fairs, she buys small animals to sell in the city of Ayacucho. Victoria needs a loan of 2,500 soles. This money will be invested in purchasing rice, sugar and pasta. Victoria's dreams are to improve her business and for her children to be have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Mamrachab

texts.ru: Чориев Мамрачаб проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сыновья на заработках в России. Сам Мамрачаб занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mamrachab C. lives in the Yavan district. He is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. The sons work in Russia. Mamrachab is involved in animal husbandry. He owns a small cowshed, where he breeds livestock. He has been involved in this type of business for over 5 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Reynalyn

texts.en:
Reynalyn G. is from the village of Brgy Sta. Rosa, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old and single. To make a living, Reynalyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Reynalyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Reynalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynalyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Reynalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old man from Lebanon. He is married, and he and his wife have three children. He has been working in floor tiling for the past 26 years.

He is now seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase new tools to improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his tiling business by purchasing new tools

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with one daughter who is attending college. Oksana is in the grocery sales business selling a variety of food products in the busy central market. She has two kiosks and hires a lady to help her with sales.

Oksana started her business thirteen years ago selling tea and coffee at one of the local markets. She saved her money and was able to expand, setting up a second kiosk in the central city market. She is an entrepreneur of integrity – very punctual and communicative. She manages a very brisk trade at her vending kiosks and many loyal customers keep coming back because of her friendly attitude, cheerful nature and willingness to serve them well.

Oksana would like a loan of 12,200 UAH to expand the range of food products she has available such as coffee, tea, candy, chocolates, mayonnaise, and vegetable oil. She is planning to purchase these groceries wholesale so that she can get a good price.

Income generated from Oksana’s business will allow her to invest more in her daughter’s education as well as provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To expand the range of food products she has available

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Norn Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eleven people who live Chuos village in Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Sokha N. is a village bank president who is 32-year-old, selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also Khmer cake seller while her husband, Mr. Hul Hen, is a construction worker. Now she has some problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Sokha N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she hires farming laborers. She is a mother of four children, thee of whom are attending in local public school, while the youngest one is four-year-old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Alegres Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el invernadero D. la señora Ana Isabel B. C. que es integrante del grupo Las Alegres que se reúne en Tenancingo, Edo Mex. Y en la cual se ven los brotes D. las plantas D. nombre “Alcatraz” que ella cultiva.
 Ella se dedica a la siembra y venta D. flores pues es floricultora, este negocio lo inició hace ya 6 años con la ayuda D. su marido y hoy la D. sus hijos manteniendose D. las ganancias D. este negocio. 
Su préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en el empaque D. su próxima cosecha, ya que según comenta es lo más importante por que D. esa manera se conservan en mejor estado y se mantienen con más vida sus flores.  
Sus clientes opinan lo mismo, dicen que lo que buscan es un mejor empaque y ella es conocida en la venta D. las flores por su actitud al vender, es una comerciante agresiva debido al empeño que pone a sus ventas.
Ella siempre muestra la alegría que la caracteriza esa es la verdadera razón del nombre del grupo Las Alegres. 
En la foto es la primera señora D. izquierda a derecha, D. camiseta blanca  corta y pantalón azul. Tiene 28 años y estudio solo hasta segundo D. primaria tiene 3 hijos ellos son Herendirá R., D. 11 años y esta en la primaria, Gabriel R. D. 7 años y esta en 3ero D. primaria y Marco R. D. 6 años y este año entrara a la primaria, esta casada con Eustolio V. M. D. 42 años el se dedica a la construcción D. estructuras para invernadero y para ellos el éxito consiste en estar todos juntos como familia ayudándose.
El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes que son:
Ana Isabel B.C.
Edén H. D. J.
Lilia A. C. 
María Teresita M. H.
Fátima G. W. 
Luz María E. G.
Romelia H. E.
Victoria B. M.
Candelaria M. A.
Ma. del Carmen W. M.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the nursery of Mrs.Ana Isabel B. C., who is a member of the Las Alegres (Happy Women) group that meets in Tenancingo, Edo Mex. Also in the photo are shoots of the “Alcatraz” plants that she grows. She grows and sells flowers since she is a flower-grower. She began this business six years ago with the help of her husband and now with that of her children, supporting the family with the earnings from this business. She will use the loan to invest in packing materials for her next harvest, since she says that is the most important thing because in this way the flowers stay fresher and live longer. Her customers have the same opinion; they say they are looking for better packaging. She is well-known in flower sales for her attituD. about selling; she is an aggressive businesswoman because of the effort she puts into her sales. She always shows the happiness that characterizes her. This is the true reason for naming the group Las Alegres. In the photo, Ana Isabel is the first woman from left to right, wearing a short-sleeved white shirt and blue pants. She is 28 years old and studied only through the second year of elementary school. She has three children. They are Herendirá R., who is 11 and in elementary school, Gabriel R. who is 7 and in the third year of elementary school, and Marco R. who is 6 and will begin elementary school this year. She is married to Eustolio V. M., who is 42. He works in greenhouse and nursery construction, and for them success lies in being all together as a family and helping each other. This group is maD. up of 10 members who are: Ana Isabel B.C. Edén H. D. J. Lilia A. C. María Teresita M. H. Fátima G. W. Luz María E. G. Romelia H. E. Victoria B. M. Candelaria M. A. Ma. del Carmen W. M.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Packaging for her next harvest

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La Sra. Felip es una cliente antigua D. grupo solidario,  ha mostrando responsabilidad   en el pago D. su créditos, ella tiene la determinación D. mejorar el negocio y que este sea conocido por la variedad D. platos que se pueD. encontrar en este, la señora Felipa es emprendedora, el puesto D. venta  se  encuentra en la  zona D. Villa Tunari  cerca D. la  conocida universidad publica D. el alto ,la señora se esfuerza por superarse ya que trabaja desD. la madrugada hasta que se pone el sol, el esposo  ayuda en la atención D. la pensión   el  apoya ese sueño D. convertirse en  una empresaria, el mayor anhelo D. la clienta es llegar a ser reconocida por la sociedad en su lucha D. mejorar su calidad D. vida, con el dinero del crédito ampliara su pensión comprando mas sillas y mesas, platos y cubiertos.
texts.en:
Felipa is a long-time client of the solidarity group. She has shown herself to be responsible paying her loans. She is determined to improve her business and that it become known for the variety of dishes that can be found there. Felipa is entrepreneurial. Her business is located in the Villa Tunari zone near the well-known public university “El Alto”. She works hard to improve; she works from dawn to dusk. Her husband helps in attending to the restaurant. He supports her dream of becoming a business woman. Her biggest desire is to be recognized by society in her struggle to improve her quality of life. With the money from the loan, she will expand her restaurant by buying more chairs, tables, plates and silverware.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business (restaurant)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She hopes to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man and has four school-age children. He lives in Lebanon. He is the main income provider for his family; that’s why he works hard to satisfy their needs. 

He has 10 years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2004. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. With the help of the loan, he will enlarge his cultivation because he is planning to deliver the harvest to a bigger agriculture market and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en: Ni Komang R. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. She is married and has three adult children. Ni Komang R.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 250,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2009, Ni Komang R. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ni Komang R. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from MUK which was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from MUK. Ni Komang R. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. Ni Komang R. is the leader of a 10 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. The official name of this borrowing group is "Pigy Lestari" (PK-10313). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. As the leader of this group, Ni Komang R. hopes the group can become financially independent so they do not need to borrow again. This is evidenced by requiring each member to save in accordance with their capabilities. When the numbers are sufficient, the group members can pay off their loans. About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Ni Komang R. 0 (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Komang R. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Pigy Lestari (PK-10313). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Komang R. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang R. menghasilkan sekitar 0,250 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni Komang R. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Komang R. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.000.000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.000.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mr. Keo C. is a 39 years old a married man and father. Keo C. currently owns a small furniture selling business. He produces beds and also collects to buy them in bulk from other beds makers who are nearby neighbors. He then sells these beds at retail prices from door-to-door in the community. 

His wife appears on the photo. She is a businesswoman who purchases salt and crops in bulk to resell for a profit. 

Keo C. has been facing difficulty with transportation for years because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. Therefore, Keo C. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase a used motorbike. Any remaining cash from the loan, he will use to increase the capital of his bed business.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike.

loans.name: Nury Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

La señora Nury es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por los beneficios que brinda la institución a sus socias. Tiene 51 años de edad, hace varios años el compañero de su vida falleció pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos son mayores, el ultimo que es menor de edad vive con ella.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también tiene muchos clientes que le encargan sus productos, trabaja de miércoles a domingo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra los días sábados. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio como 15 años y que le va bien por la clientela que tiene. Los productos los compra en Guayaquil cada fin de mes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para ir a Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería. Sus sueños son terminar su casa y construir un pequeño local para vender en su casa.
texts.en:
The Picoaza Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, its traditional festivals in honor of St. Peter and St. Paul, and the rich cultural history contained within its mountains.

Sra. Nury is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the availability of loans and benefits that Fundación ESPOIR provides to its members. She is 51 years old and was married for several years before her husband passed away. This relationship resulted in five children, four of whom are adults. The youngest child is still a minor and lives with her.

Nury is a merchant, selling all types of clothing door-to-door. She also has several customers who place orders with her for these products. Nury works Wednesday through Sunday. She offers her products on credit and collects payments on Saturdays. Nury says she has been in this business for 15 years and has done well because of her customers. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil at the end of the month.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise in Guayaquil. Her dreams include finishing the construction of her house and establishing a small store in her home.

loans.use: Purchase all types of clothing

loans.name: Futuro De Vida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro de Vida está formado por 11 mujeres que realizan  diferentes actividades para ayudar en la economía de sus hogares y poder  salir  adelante, y asi dan el ejemplo a sus hijos. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, la arquitectura de sus iglesias, su gastronomía y su gente que se caracteriza por ser cordial y amable.

La Señora María G. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene  un niño de 6 meses de edad, su esposo labora en un talle de aluminio y vidrio. 
Doña María labora como secretaria de en un taller de aluminio y vidrio, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y por la noche en su casa se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, trabaja de lunes a domingo,  vende hamburguesas hot dog  y papas fritas.
Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga.  El dinero de su crédito va a utilizar en comprar los víveres para la preparación de sus productos. Su meta es crecer y salir adelante con su negocio.

La Señora Rosa I. vive por el sector de la Empresa Eléctrica, es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por que puede estar con sus amigas y así sale de la rutina. Se dedica realizar los quehaceres de una casa en donde cuida de dos abuelitos, labora todo el tiempo que ellos la necesiten, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años.
Doña Rosa tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de 6 hijos que tienen 14, 13, 9, 7, 2 años de edad y un bebe de meses, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su tercero y cuarto hijos están en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 Con su nuevo crédito va a iniciar en el negocio de cría de cerdos. Su meta es ser una buena madre para sus hijos y darles todo lo que esté en sus manos para que se superen
texts.en:
The Futuro de Vida (Life’s Future) communal bank has 11 female members that are in various activities designed to improve the economies of their homes and to get ahead in life thus providing a good example for their children.  They live in various parts of Cuenca, a city known for the four rivers that bathe it, the architecture of its churches, its gastronomy and its residents who are characteristically kind and cordial.

Mrs. María G., 28, lives in Cuenca.  She’s married and has a 6-month-old son.  Her husband is employed in an aluminum and glass workshop.  María is employed as a Secretary at an aluminum and glass workshop.  She works from Monday through Friday from 8am until 6pm.  At night she works from home selling fast food from Monday through Sunday.  She sells hamburgers, hotdogs and fried potatoes.

This is the first loan she’s taken in the communal bank; she was invited to join by a girl friend.  The funds will be used to buy ingredients to prepare her products.  Her goal is to grow and get ahead with her business.

Mrs. Rosa I. lives in the Empresa Eléctrica neighborhood.  This is her second loan with the communal bank.  She likes it because she can be with her friends and get out of her usual routine.  She works at a home where senior citizens are cared for doing domestic chores.  She works whenever she’s needed and has been doing this for five years.

Rosa is 29 years old and a single mother of six children who are 14, 13, 9, 7, and 2 years old and a baby who is a few months old.  Her oldest two children go to high school in the city, her third and fourth children are in school.  She does not own her house; she rents.

She will use the loan to start a business raising pigs.  Her goal is to be a good mother to her children and to give them everything she can so that they will do well.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs/To start raising pigs.

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Dorcas Group

texts.en:
The Women’s Bank of Dorcas is a group comprised of 7 women members who live in Paso Canoas, Puntarenas. Each individual member is involved in a commercial activity such as sewing or various types of sales (shoes, clothing, jewelry, livestock and catalogue items). Each woman will use this loan to make general investments in their productive activity. For example, to purchase chickens, animal feed, or various merchandise for sale. As the Christmas season is upon us, many Costa Ricans will be making gift purchases this month. This represents an opportunity for these women to increase their revenues.  

Maria Ofelia, the elected president of this group, is a 63-year-old mother of 8 who lives by herself in Paso Canoas. Maria has a sewing business. She produces bedding such as sheets, blankets and pillow covers. She sews during the daytime and at night she prepares the projects she plans to work on for the next day. 

The community of Paso Canoas is plagued by poverty, partially due to a serious lack of job opportunities. Maria’s goal is to create a better living situation for herself, her fellow group members, as well as strive to provide employment opportunities in the community at large. Her main obstacle has been a lack of access to working capital. This loan will help to address this issue. 

The members of The Women’s Bank of Dorcas know each other from living in the same community and from meetings at the local church. Maria says the main benefit of receiving a loan from Fundacion Mujer is the low interest rate that will be charged, as compared to other financial institutions. The name of this group is symbolic of a hardworking woman that the members learned of in the bible.

loans.use: For the purchase of various merchandise for sale such as shoes, clothing, livestock and jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Comprar mercadería en ropa de vestir. 
To buy merchandise, ie., clothing.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de refrescos y panes, vive con sus hijos uno de 29 años y el otro de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, todos trabajan en su familia, residen en El Transito,  el negocio lo comenzó por iniciativa propia, por la necesidad de velar por los gastos de su familia, sus ventas la realiza en el mercado municipal de El Transito, con un horario de 8:00am a 5:00pm, actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como bebidas, pan, pollo y condimentos entre otro que son necesarios para la venta.
La compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y le permitirá tener mayores ingresos en la familia, sus aspiraciones son mantener el negocio fuerte, crecer en clientela y mejorar las condiciones económicas de la familia.
texts.en:
Alba is 47 years old.  Her business is selling soft drinks and bread.  She is a single mother and lives with her children aged 29 and 25 in El Transito.  All the members of her family work.

Alba started her business on her own initiative as she needed to take care of her family's expenses.  She makes her sales in El Transito town market and works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.

Alba is currently requesting a loan to buy products such as drinks, bread, chicken, condiments and other goods that are necessary for her business.  These purchases will help to strengthen her business and allow her to make more income for her family.  Her goals are to keep her business strong, to increase her number of customers and to improve her family's finances.

loans.use: To buy products such as drinks, bread, chicken and condiments

loans.name: Daria

texts.es:
Daría es socia del Banco Comunal San Jose de Viñaca, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Daría tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general, donde tambien vende verduras y frutas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, sal, leche, aguas gaseosas. a Daría le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por los créditos que le dan y porque puede ahorrar, le gusta las capacitaciones porque les enseñan que las mujeres y varones tienen los mismos derechos.
Su sueño es construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Daría is a member of the San José de Viñaca communal bank. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She has a general grocery store where she also sells fruits and vegetables. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, pasta, oil, salt, milk, and carbonated water. Daría likes the communal bank meetings because of the loans that they give and also because she can save. She likes the trainings because they teach them that women and men have the same rights.

Her dream is to build her house and for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, oil

loans.name: Nasandelger

texts.en:
Nasandelger, 35, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in the Bayanhongor Province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (Mongolian nomadic housing tent). His wife works as a salesperson for a company and his oldest son attends a local primary school. He started a transportation service business with his brother in 2000. In 2007, he began a wholesale trading business specializing in flour and rice which are loaded on a 20-ton container. 

Now, he drives a car at Tavan Tolgoi, the biggest coal mine in Mongolia, located close to the Chinese border. He is a hard-working and modest person who says, "I am planning to build a house on my land that I bought three years ago. Therefore, I have to make more money. But in the future, I am thinking to operate a stable business in order to take care of my health." 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to help pay for the necessary spare parts and for maintenance costs for his car. His truck must be maintained properly in order for him to obtain income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca de 51años de edad, nació en la comarca el Coyolito, la Concordia municipio de Jinotega, es casada con tres  hijos, es comerciante y  ama de casa, ya que atiende  una pulpería. Inicio el  negocio de la pulpería con ayuda de su marido en la comarca el Coyolito localizada 28 kilómetros de Estelí, trasladando el producto desde Estelí  hasta la comunidad para poder venderlo. Además se dedican a la venta de leche pues poseen ganado y esto les ayuda a pagar los estudios  de sus tres hijos, que es su prioridad  ya que ella no pudo terminar su secundaria por problemas económicos y el difícil acceso a los lugares de estudios. Ella espera que al ampliar  su negocio ella mejorara sus ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo  para ampliar y abastecer el negocio, poder abastecerse de  la mayor cantidad de producto  y vender más, y generar mayores ingresos.
