Abdalah belongs to the group Songambele (Swahili for “going forward”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 22 years old. He lives in the region of Saida in South Lebanon. Mohamad owns a fruit and vegetable store. This is the third time he is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. This time he needs $1200 to assist him in purchasing a pickup truck for the transportation of provisions. Mohamad is constantly striving to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a pickup truck to transport provisions

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Định, 31 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children at Tự Lập village of Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc. She’s been a member of the TYM Fund for 12 years. After 2 rounds of loan she realizes that taking out big loan and weekly repayments fit her family’s business very well. Her decision of changing from raising pigs to poultry has prospered the business. She also built 2 incubators to provide ducklings to others poultry farms in the area. The income is about 300USD a month. She is well deserved the achievement award from the Fund. This time she would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to buy feed for her ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Định, 31 tuổi, đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Tự Lập, Mê Linh, Vĩnh Phúc là thành viên năm thứ 12 của Quỹ. Sau hai vòng vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi chị Định nhận thấy việc vay vốn lớn hoàn trả tuần rất phù hợp với gia đình. Nằm trên địa bàn thuần nông và chăn nuôi, lại gần chợ là nơi trao đổi hàng hoá rất thuận lợi, nắm bắt được thị hiếu người tiêu dùng, gia đình chị mạnh dạn chuyển từ chăn nuôi lợn sang chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và vịt thịt (1200 con) mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Không dừng lại ở đó gia đình chị còn xây thêm 2 lò ấp trứng, ngoài việc cung cấp con giống cho địa bàn xã, huyện, gia đình chị còn làm thêm trứng vịt lộn cung cấp cho khách hàng. Thu nhập từ dự án mang lại hàng tháng là 300USD. Chị Định và gia đình xứng đáng là gương điển hình làm kinh tế giỏi mà chi nhánh và xã trao tặng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 1200USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn vịt.

loans.use: Buy feed for ducks

loans.name: Nancy Magaly

texts.en:
Nancy has been a member of the community bank “Suni” for four years. In that time she has learned to be responsible, disciplined, and to save. Nancy works in the country and attends meetings monthly instead of weekly. She likes this arrangement and is happy that the community bank was able to work with her to find a plan that worked

When Nancy first joined the community bank she sold the vegetables that her in-laws grow in their garden. Now she and her husband have been able to buy a motorcycle taxi and start a business selling motor oils and candies at a gas station. Nancy needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying a greater variety of motor oils.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earnings savings account each associate has. Nancy plans use her savings to build a house. Her dream is to be able to have a farm and raise animals.

loans.use: Nancy needs a loan of 2500 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying a greater variety of motor oils.

loans.name: Sheha's Mji Mwema Group

texts.en:
Sheha is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 11, and 4 years old. Sheha is a tailor, a business she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business.

In the past, Sheha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth selling, pharmacy, and soft drink selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Nemecia works all day, every day, in a small space outside her home which she established with the goal of selling vegetables in the morning and sandwiches in the evening. With the income that she receives daily from her work, she can fully maintain her beloved children. She wishes to increase her capital in order to make a greater quantity of meals and to make her facilities more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Nemecia, labora todo el día y todos los días en un pequeño espacio fuera de su hogar que estableció con el propósito de comercializar vegetales por las mañanas y diversos bocadillos por las tardes. Con el ingreso que percibe a diario por su labor puede mantener plenamente a sus queridos hijos.Desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para elaborar mayor cantidad de alimentos y para hacer más cómoda sus instalaciones de servicio.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her products and service.

loans.name: Adabus

texts.id:
After paying his first loan, Adabus' mineral water selling business is increasing. He has many customers. Adabus usually sells 50 gallons of mineral water each day, and after receiving loan from DINARI, he is able to sell 100 gallons a day. His customers are not only those who live near him, but also those who live away from him. Adabus charges various delivery cost for various distance of delivery. he plans to use the proposed loan to increase his capital to enlarge his business.

Now Adabus is living with his wife and children. They rent a land and built a semi-permanent house on it.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak melunasi pinjaman periode pertama, usaha Adabus mengalami perkembangan sampai saat ini. Usaha jual air mineral kelilingnya cukup banyak memiliki pelanggan. Biasanya dia berjualan air mineral sampai 50 galon per hari. Tapi sejak mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI dia bisa mendapatkan pelanggan sampai 100 galon air mineral per hari. Konsumennya bukan hanya penduduk sekitar rumahnya tetapi juga berada di tempat yang jauh. Untuk ongkos mengantar bervariasi tergantung jarak pelanggan. Recananya, pinjaman kali ini akan dijadikan modal tambahan sehingga nantinya usahanya bisa lebih besar dan maju. Saat ini Adabus S. tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya. Mereka menyewa tanah per tahunda membangun rumah semi permanen diatasnya. Keadaan keluarganya sehat.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Magda Victoria

texts.es:
Magda Gonzáles dedicates herself arduously to her seamstress business in the Sandino City neighborhood of Managua, where she tends to clients out of her home. Magda is a single mother of two whom she cares for as a mother and father at the same time. Her main goal is to expand her business and thus improve the economic conditions of her humble household. Today she looks for financial support from Kiva partner Ceprodel with the hope of purchasing sewing supplies such as fabrics, thread, needles, etc. The loan will benefit her children as much as her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Magda Gonzáles se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de costurería donde atiende a sus clientes en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende su negocio.

Actualmente es madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener por lo que lleva a cabo el papel de padre y madre a la vez. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su costurería para así mejorar las condiciones económicas de su humilde hogar. Hoy en día busca un apoyo financiero en Ceprodel con el propósito de comprar los materiales de trabajo para la costurería como lo es la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, etc. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies (fabrics, thread, needles, etc.) / Compra de materiales para el trabajo

loans.name: Chhoeum

texts.en: Chhoeum K., 42, makes wine and raises pigs with her husband, Kleng Phal in Siem Reap. They support their two children as well, one is a student and the other is a sculptor. They typically make US$5 each day together.  They have asked for a loan of US$350 to purchase more piglets to breed. The way that pigs are raised in Cambodia is that they are fed a wine that most pig breeders also make to help them sleep and become very large, very fast. So most pig breeders are also making wine and the family believes that their income can be increased through this investment. Chhoeum and her husband look forward to the opportunity to improve their standard of living and see the fruits of their investment.

loans.use: Purchase more piglets to breed

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn S., 38, works together with her husband, Khim Bora, running a small grocery store in their home. They have three children, and they would like to see their US$3 per day income increased.

Yorn S. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery products and expand her current family business. She believes that by offering a wider variety of products, she can expand her customer base and increase her income. She looks forward to seeing how this investment will impact her business and is optimistic about improving her family's standard of living and quality of life.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs Chea D. was born in 1969 and she now lives in Sampan Kraom Village in Kandal Province. She is a port seller in the local market and her husband, Mr Khoeng Chhoeurn, is a cow breeder who raises two cows. Mrs Chea D. has two children who are attending the local school.

Although Mrs Chea D. and her husband have two businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve this standard of living, Mrs Chea D. decided to ask for a loan to start pig breeding business. She will buy five pigs and the rest of the loan she will use to buy pig food.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар  у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Раджабова Замира жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 24 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка более 5 лет занимается куплей продажей женской одежды.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке .Этот вид деятельности помогает ей содержать свою семью,так как муж клиентки находится в России.В данный момент Замира хочет закупить товар у оптовых поставщиков.планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: закуп товара

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
El Sr. Milciades Giménez está casado hace 7 años con Mabel con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años por quien trabaja todos los días para brindarle una buena educación.

Comenta que sus padres se separaron cuando era un niño lo que le obligó a buscar trabajo desde muy joven para poder solventar sus estudios y ayudar a su madre también con los gastos del hogar.

Trabajó como chofer de ómnibus por muchos años y renunció para comprarse un vehiculo que hoy día utiliza como taxi, dicha actividad viene desarrollando hace 1 año con muy buenos resultados.

Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa debido a que trabaja a la par de él vendiendo ropas casa por casa, ayudando así a obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sustento familiar.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una parada de taxi, ya que en Paraguay, existen varios proveedores de este servicio que están ubicados en esquinas de distintos puntos, y Milciades en la actualidad está alquilando una y eso le genera un costo adicional.
texts.en:
Mr. Milciades Giménez has been married to Mabel for 7 years. They have a seven-year-old son, for whom they work every day so that they can offer him a good education.

His parents separated when he was a child. Because of this, he was obligated to work from a very young age to pay for school and also to help his mother with the household expenses.

He worked as a bus driver for many years and gave it up to buy a vehicle that he now uses as a taxi. He has been pursuing this activity for a year with very good results.

He counts on the unconditional support of his wife, because she sells clothes door to door. In this way, she helps to earn the income necessary for the family’s sustenance.

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy a taxi stand. In Paraguay there are many providers of this service that are located on corners at different points, and Milciades, at present, is renting one, which costs him more.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi stand

loans.name: Shahali

texts.en: Shahali is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the town of Fuzuli, and he settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Dilagarda village. Ten years ago he started his business selling souvenirs and glassware, tea things, and other things. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 (970 AZN) to buy souvenirs and other items to sell.

loans.use: Buy souvenirs and other items to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is 35 years old. She is married with five kids and lives with her family in New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Esi sells eggs in her neighborhood. She balances her stock of eggs on her head and moves around to sell. She says the price of eggs has almost doubled over the last few months--an increase in bird attacks in some of the poultry farms where she gets her daily supply have forced her to travel very far at additional cost to purchase eggs. With the loan, she wants to buy more crates of eggs to avoid the constant price hikes. She hopes to save more income to support her kids in school.

Esi is a member of the Kingdom Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to obtain loans and support one another in repaying the loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs

loans.name: Bashiran Ahmad Din Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Baji is a 40-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its shrines and people come to see them. She is an uneducated lady because her school was far away from the house and no one was available to take her to school, which is why she quit her studies. Her husband's name is A. D. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. People come to him to buy groceries for their houses. He has a good reputation among the people.

She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son is involved in a fruit selling business. The next goes to school. Her other kids are free and don’t do anything. Bashiran Baji has a talent for sewing clothes. She polishes her quality and adopted this work as a profession. Now she sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and earns a profit. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Momna Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Waziran Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Motian Baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Zainab Baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Shazia Baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Kosim

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1970, N. Kosim now lives with his wife and their three children. They are also responsible for caring of his aged mother. A teacher by profession, Kosim is also a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Kosim would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of $1000 USD to buy fertilizer. This income will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and educate all his children with higher education. Kosim is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to tmhe 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel sells palm oil to his customers. He started this business in the year 2000. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell to his customers. He is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Nyanial

texts.en:
Nyanial Y. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice and cabbages and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Nyanial is 22 years old and is married to a soldier. She has one child and her child does not yet go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Twenty-nine people living in Kampong Svay village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Bunthin S. is forty-one years old and the village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small store. Since her business is doing well, she has a lot of customers and their needs are many. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for her customers, and that will help her to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Hong Meng, is a construction worker. This couple has four childR., three of whom are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Matata

texts.en:
Matata A., 52, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the villagers and the public three days per week. She has four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about $187).

SPBD loans are Matata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The entirety of the loan will be used to maintain her business needs. Specifically, she would like to purchase goggles, a fishing net, and a flashlight.

loans.use: To purchase goggles, a fishing net, and a flashlight.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 65 years old, is married and has given birth to nine children: four sons and five daughters. According to Yaa, all her children have completed school and are currently working. Some are married. She lives with her husband and some of her grandchildren in a rented apartment in a a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Yaa is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital, and sells them in the local market on a tabletop. She also journeys to other towns to sell. She has been in this business for two years and hopes to obtain a loan to procure fish in bulk. 

She hopes to expand her business and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish for sale.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es: Nemesia tiene 59 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida, recientemente, hace 3 meses, alquiló un local donde atiende todos los días por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes se dedica a preparar todo lo necesario para el día siguiente. Debido a su buena sazón ha logrado incrementar su clientela regular, lo cual es muy importante porque sabe la cantidad de porciones seguras que vende diariamente, con las que obtiene las ganancias para sustentar las necesidades de su casa y el capital para su negocio al día siguiente. Sus planes a corto tiempo son de decorar su local e implementar mejor su cocina. Es la primera vez que Nemesia tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene grandes deseos de ser una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de mesas y una pequeña cocina a gas.
texts.en:
Nemesia is 59 years old and lives with her 4 children in her own home. She has been selling food for 4 years and recently, about 3 months ago, she rented a location from which she works during the morning since during the afternoon she works preparing food for the following day. Due to her flavorful food she has managed to increase the number of regular clients that she has, which is very important because she know the quantity of servings that she'll sell daily through which she obtains the income to cover the household expenses and the business capital for the following day. Her short-term plans are to decorate her business location and improve her kitchen. This is the first time that Nemesia has had a loan with MFP and she has a great desire to be one of the most active members of her communal bank. The requested money will be used to purchase tables and a small gas stove.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and improvments to restaurant kitchen

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 50 years old. She is a widow and has three children. She trades in assorted washing soaps and kerosene in the local market of Kasoa, a town in the Central Region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She requests for a loan to enable her to buy cartons of soap and barrels of kerosene to expand her business and to scale up sales. She hopes to increase her savings enough to support her last child’s education. She belongs to the community group called Abigail Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of soap and barrels of kerosene.

loans.name: Desak Putu Sarini

texts.en: Desak Putu Sarini (DNR.M-0578) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. Desak Putu Sarini owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Desak Putu Sarini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 4th from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Desak Putu Sarini - (DNR.M-0578) merupakan 43 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Desak Putu Sarini memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Desak Putu Sarini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Desak Putu Sarini menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Desak Putu Sarini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Desak Putu Sarini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Desak Putu Sarini berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun O., 65, is a widow living in Battambong province with her four children. She is a cleaner in a hotel in the town and makes about $5 USD a day, but it is not enough to support her family so two of her children send money every month from their work in garment factories. The global financial crisis has had unfavorable consequences for Khun O.'s family's standard of living, and inflation has been high. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, O. included.

In light of these difficulties, Khun O. is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new sewing machines for members of her family. She sees these new sewing machines as a great economic opportunity for her. She believes that the machines will help to both increase her income and improve her standard of living. (One of her daughters is shown in the picture.)

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines

loans.name: Jocelie

texts.en:
Jocelie B., age 40, is from the town of Aloran. Jocelie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelie raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Jocelie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Karim S. est un célibataire sans enfant de 24 ans qui vit à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au  commerce d’articles divers et  dispose aujourd’hui  d’une boutique devant sa maison d’habitation où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers tels les cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, chewing-gum,  laits en poudre, thés, mayonnaises, sucre, savons etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre il y a environ une année, l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  après une anticipation du précédent.
Monsieur S. vend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de jeunes et de voisins.
Avec ce deuxième  prêt, il compte acheter,  5 cartouches de cigarettes différentes, 7 cartons de thés, 5 cartons de mayonnaise CALVE, 10 sacs du sucre, 3 cartons de savon,  5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de chewing gum, 20 paquets d’allumette et 10 sacs de riz. 
Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Monsieur Karim S. is a 24 year old bachelor who lives in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the République of Mali). After trying other enterprises,Monsieur S. opened a shop in front of his house where he sells miscellaneous merchandise, ranging from cigarettes, candy, matches and chewing-gum to powdered milk, tea, mayonnaise, sugar and soap, etc. His shop is very popular because of the quality of his merchandise. Monsieur S. sells to both cash and credit clients, most of whom are youth and neighbors. To satisfy increased demand, a year ago he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This will be his second loan. With the proceeds, he plans to buy 5 cases of different cigarettes, 7 cases of tea, 5 cases of CALVE mayonnaise, 10 bags of sugar, 3 cases of soap, 5 boxes of candies, 10 cases of chewing gum, 20 packages of matches, and 10 bags of rice. He purchases his merchandise from wholesalers. He expects to realize a monthly benefit of 125 000 FCFA which he will use to build his inventory, contribute to his family's expenses, and repay his loan.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Veronica Jerotich

texts.en:
Veronica is a 55 years old widow. She is a mother of ten children who solely depend on her. Her residential place is Levegeya in Eldoret.

Veronica B. was introduced to KADET by a member. She has applied for a school loan to pay her children's school fees. She has a small scale business which she believes will be able to 

She wants to be able to educate her children to the highest level of education in order for them to acquire the best education which she believes will be her biggest investment.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: Yawa A.  is currently in the business of selling various items such as: bags of salt, biscuits etc and is requesting a loan to purchase 2 bags of sugar to sell.  Yawa is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is an engineer. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to keep on stocking more items in her shop for sale BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase 2 bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Fansi

texts.en: Fansi sells jewelry to make a living. She is 44 years old and married with one child. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina M. sells bags of charcoal, rice, sugar and so on at Elmina near the seashore, which she has been doing since 2001. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with electronics. She has been through junior high school. Augustina uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase bags of charcoal and bags of rice to sell. Augustina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to reinvest in it.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Ndata

texts.fr: Ndata G. est mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle est âgée de 52 ans. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH depuis 7 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a bien remboursé. Elle vend de l'arachide et du mil ce qui lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permet de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndata G. is married and the mother of seven children.  She is 52 years old.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH for 7½ year where she benefited from 15 loans, which she has repaid.  Ndata sells peanuts and millet, which brings in the profits enabling her to help cover various family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her commercial work

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene una imprenta donde realiza trabajos de impresión de folletos, libros, menbretados, y otros.
Su domicilio y su taller de imprenta se encuentran ubicados  la calle comercio de la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada, tiene dos empleados y requiere el crédito para la compra de papel cola y tintas
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Wilson has a printing press where he produces brochures, books, engraved stationary, and other items. His home and his printing workshop are located in a rented house in a commercial street in the central part of the city of La Paz. He has 2 employees and he needs a loan to buy paper, glue and inks. This is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO. The desire to work and improve his quality of life has motivated him to pursue this credit opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy paper, glue and inks for his printing business

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Novaya Kahovka. He owns a small business selling office appliances, related components and expendable materials in one of the local malls called “Central”. He launched this business about 12 years ago. Currently, his business has grown up to 15,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His monthly net profit is little over 4,000 Grivnyas.

Andrei is seeking a loan of 7,400 Grivnyas to expand his business. His venture has seen considerable growth since he received his first loan. Andrei is hoping to witness further consistent growth of his trade after using this loan. A portion of profits generated will be invested in his business while some of it will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, sand and ceramic tile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock yams, rice and beans, buy oil and flour for her restaurant

loans.name: Fhang

texts.en:
Mr. Fhang P. is 53 years old and lives in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ra Noun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops to support their family living.

In the rice field they have a problem because it is time to harvest the rice but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mr. Fhang P. decided to apply for a loan to hire laborers to harvest his rice.

Mr. Fhang P. is the father of five children, two of whom help with the farming while the others are attending the local public school. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest his rice

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa J. is from the village of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Diosa is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Diosa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Diosa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2005, Diosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Diosa is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Diosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business
